Blog.post: Well, today was the last day of classes. You get that good feeling that you're done, but that awful feeling that exams are only two days away. And that awful head and stomach ache that's left over from yesterday's experience with the flu. While sick on the couch i did get to watch a lot of bad daytime TV. I never realised how long spelling bees are. Or that they have the national "bee" on ESPN. Nice winning word though, Prospicience, i coulda spelled that. Some pretty tough ones too. I'm pretty sure most of them don't exist in English but they assure me that Soavamente (if that is how you spell it) is in the Webster's complete edition (a 13 pound book!). But enough of that. The year is almost over but it still isn't summer yet... I wish the weather would get better. It's too damn cold for may, tommorrow is JUNE!!!! There's the bell... better get to class. seeya
urlLink HyperHistory This site really is rather neat... well maybe you're not a complete geek like me that watches star trek on the new TNN and stuff... i think it's cool.

Good day to you, I was very glad to see today that Mr. Art Eggleton was fired from his position as Defence Minister. The Toronto Sun said it best with this headline "Eggs Fried". Let's face it the man was incompetent and a scam artist. He paid his girlfriend like 16 grand to write a report on why soldiers in war experience stress. Maybe he should have been the minister of TOTAL F#CKING OBVIOUSNESS! Good riddance. Another crack in the Liberal Party... excellent. My guess is that they won't win the next election. At least not with Crouton at the helm. Assembly today was pretty funny we all arrived in Laidlaw hall to find cheap porno magazines strewn about the pews, the leaving class prank no doubt. Some funny reactions include Briglio apologising for 'taking away your magazines, boys.' but then explaining that they were going to 'Mr. Miller's private collection'. And Blakey telling George Lace to give his 'magazine' to Mr. McKay, even though he didn't have one. And when smckell got up to do his badminton presentation he didn't mention the word badminton... until he started naming players I had no idea what he was talking about. I loved how Blakey was like "yes... badminton is an excellent sport" afterwards. Ah McKell, what crazy sherbrooke tricks have you yet to pull from up your sleeves... Well thats all for the day. Have a nice week!

What up G's? I know I haven't been posting to this thingy lately but I'm busy okay. No one reads it anyways. I was at Ontario Model Parliament the last two days. Good stuff going on there. Looked good for the PC party when we agreed witht the NDP to vote down the liberals on their age of majority bill. But then we were totally shafted by the Liberals and NDP who seemed to have made an alliance on the next two bills and the budget... so that was bad. Not to mention they block voted against my private members bill proposing jail time for skateboarding anywhere but in a skatepark... damn skaters. Will voted against it and he was in my party. If you see will hiss at him. rrrrgh. But I did follow tradition and say "jibba jabba" once again in the house. Didn't seem as big a deal. Oh, and Jack Morawetz is the man. Twice the man I am, I might add. As a seat filler, when no Sr. MPP wanted to speak, Jack spoke and with a vengeance, on more than one occasion. He was rash blunt, and didn't apologise. Everyone should strive to be like Jack. That's my personal insight for the day.

YEAH!!! GO LEAFS GO!!!!! That was a sweet win. 3-0 for us! Bring on the Hurricanes. I seriously think we can get to the Stanley Cup Finals now. Go Leafs! After the game my dad, and my brother and I went driving up and down Yonge Street with our leafs flags and jerseys and whatnot. It really was a blast. It's like being some kind of celebrity. Everyone is cheering you on as you drive by. It's like being on top of the world! The traffic was so bad that we couldnt even get to Yonge and Eglinton! But definitely fun stuff. We had our fist WAC programs and exec meeting. Some pretty good ideas for themes came up. The Environment, Democracy?, and Globalization being the best. Wac looks like it'll be pretty good this year. So come out! Farouk sez "Go to my crappy website on Bluenet called Blueline to bet on the nhl playoffs cause I'm a retard at blueline.com" so... listen to Farouk. horkypoo out

TIGJAM and I seem to disagree on the whole Blowback thing so he says he'll write a review for Blowback and I'll put it here on my site to balance the force. So uh... watch for it. Him and I tried to put aside our differences and draft the nominees for the 1st annual UTGA Tony Awards and we did. So it's cool. GO LEAFS GO. We really pulled out a tight win there. Boy I hope we can win the series and show everyone who hates Toronto that we are a good city with cool people that are sick of everyone bashing us! Go get 'em leafs!

Blowback was amazing. It was so good. If you have time, go see it tonight. If you don't you're really missing something. You can read my review in the writing section. I also put up my latest blue page rant. It's official. NHL referees suck major ass. Did you see what happened to Tucker? And they did nothing and let the guy score. Probably the most important game of the season for the Leafs and the Sens win on a cheap goal. Well... leafs in seven. I hope...

Just got back from my second Geo trip of this week. Sweeeeet! Take Geo. Library's closing so I gotta go. New Bluepage article got published today i'll put it up later. Going to see Blowback tonight probably post a review later. Laaaaaates.
Now you can see my autobiography by clicking on Bio. This site is really coming along nicely. I'm actually proud to show it to people! Righteous!

LEAFS WON!!!!!!!!!!! Whoohoo! (as you can see, I'm happy! :) ) Now that the series is tied up 2-2 we take it back home for two games with home ice advantage. Hopefully, we can pull out two victories. What did I tell you all? Leafs in six, baby! Sens are going down. Ottawa sucks! Yeah!

I got the pics from Wai's site. I also put up the random section for stuff that's well... random. Now I only have my infamous cheetoh scam (take that Frito-Lay!). I'm just kidding, it's good." and Jeff Hume says the URL is "interesting..." well, it's not exactly gold but hell... no one comes here anyways

If the last thing I wrote wasn't enough geo propaganda, I'm making this one from Geo Class! Live from Geo class... it's me. And the day after a field trip we get an hour off class, after watching a slide show of yesterday's trip. Geo Rules!

I am reminded why I love Geo today... if full day caving field trips aren't an excuse to get really dirty (which they are) then they're an excuse to miss school. Which is why Geo rules and everyone who doesn't take Geo is dumb for thinking it's just a slacker course. And we're going on another Geo trip later this week. There's my little plug for today. Geo. Lots of field trips. Take it.

Hey there! I'm Chris, but one of my better nicknames is Horkypoo, and this is my website. Not only is this the home of my ramblings and scribbles, it's also uh... something else yet to be thought of. I'm just your average Canadian kid, who's passions include politics and the theatre. I consider myself somewhat of an amateur humorist and journalist. I'm also the only guy to ever ask Ian Urquhart what his "most favouritest moment about being a journalist" was, and the only one to "jibba jabba" in the Ontario legislature. Well that's about it... have fun and GO LEAFS GO!!!!!

After really sucking for two whole days at the tournament, I went out and played today and found that when not under so much pressure I play a lot better. Although my game needs some work... I did end up seeing Star Wars yesterday. I must say although I wouldn't call it a bad film, I was a tad dissappointed. I was rather underwhelmed with Hayden Christensen as Anakin. I couldn't see him as being the same person as little Anakin from Phantom. Maybe it was the script but he just came of as a big crybaby. And what's with Padme looking exactly like she did 10 years ago but Anakin looks totally different? I really enjoyed Ewan McGregor as Obi-Wan. He managed to retain the Obi-Wan character from Phantom and add enough of the Alec Guinness Obi-Wan from the first trilogy to make it seem like he really had made that transition from student to master. Jar Jar's part was greatly reduced to many loud cheers. I didn't really mind Jar Jar, though. I found he had a certain charm to him, but I think his part is quite sufficient in this film. But what about Qui-Gon? Aside from a small mention he is all but forgotten? Jedi don't just die like that! They come back as ghosts! One ghost scene would have been cool. And Dooku isn't nearly as cool as Darth Maul. And Mace Windu sounds so lame saying "This party's over!" But enough complaining. It's all worth it for the scene where Yoda and Dooku square off in a lightsaber duel. Oh yeah... YODA! I give it thumbs up just for yoda... I'll be going to camp on friday so this will be probably the last post for a while. PEACE!!!!

School is over !!!! To tell the truth it's been over for quite some time now... my work ethic has gone to heck so I haven't posted much. I'm having trouble typing because I've gone so long without doing it. I need help! Summer is getting off to a good start. I got to play two great golf courses recently. Angus Glen's challenging North Course was home to this year's Hamish Simpson Classic, a small, well organised tournament for UCC class of 2004 guys and Cherry Downs the home course of my extended family out in Markham. Both beautiful courses and tough too. I'm playing pretty well, shaping up for this weekend's Jr. Club Championship over at my home course: the one and only Rosedale G.C. By shaping up I mean I'm practicing at golf camp this week. The highlight of which is always lunch (mmmm... PLT)! Enough about golf. I'm hoping to finally see Star Wars before the week is through, or at the very least before I head off to camp. I gotta see this yoda thing...

Exams are going pretty well. I've already written German, French, English, and Chemistry all of which went pretty well... Chem wasn't great but whatever. I saw a really good movie yesterday: Insomnia. It was a really good film. Pacino is definitely a great actor, Robin Williams wasn't bad either, Hilary Swank was good. Usually I detest these movies were the whole damn cast is Oscar winning so they can flaunt that on the previews > pay it forward > but this one is really good. Great murder mystery, even if you don't like that stuff! A pleasant surprise. And I wasn't constantly reminded of Ms. Doubtfire or Mork and Mindy... Insomnia... thumbs up!

Exams begin tommorrow and I really should be studying... But I thought I'd drop a line here on the old blog. I saw Sum of All Fears on Friday, good film. I especially liked the appearance (albeit brief) of my favourite Canadian actor: the one and only Colm Feore. I don't know why Cowie and I always see Ben Affleck films... well it was just this and Changing Lanes so you can all forgive us. Estey was there too. It was actually his idea to see it. Good pick! They blow up Baltimore! On Saturday I singlehandedly won the chipping contest at Rosedale morning clinics for my team... take that you twelve year old punks! And in the afternoon played nine holes with Cowie, upon his dad's strong suggestion that we play. ("horkmeisterrrrrr!!!!") Fun times, fun times. And the summer is officially here. Really warmed up! :)

I just got back today from camp. And I just realise how much I love being up there even more coming back home. I mean home is great but camp is just such a nice place to be with lots of friends and stuff to do. No muskats down here though, which is nice. Hopefully they'll ask me to come back next year to be a counselour in training seeing as it was my last year as a camper. I just can't see myself never going back there. My parents got my brother a basketball net while we were gone. It's pretty nice. I'm enjoying the use I get out of the ball I bought like 4 years ago. Summer is half over now... scariness. I really don't care though because I like going to school. Which is what I was saying last summer until school started. Anyways some of the younger guys at camp are UCC guys coming to the upper school. They assure me that I got the most empty headed guy as my grade 8 buddy. Joy. Well that's about it. See ya'll soon.

Summer is just flyin' by. Before long I'll be back in school. I don't know whether I want school to come or not. I'll go with not for now. I finally saw Spider-Man. (Had to go out to the huge alien spaceship theatre in the boonies to find a place where they still showed it). I gotta say it was good. I liked it better than Star Wars. Austin Powers 3 is still the best movie so far of the summer. Goin' down south to Vegas, then LA to visit family and see the sights. Gonna be sweet. Probably won't post til after. PEACE

You'd think that a month's abscense isn't enough to miss much but a quick popover to urlLink Apple.com and it seems pretty much everything has been upgraded to a new version. I decided that with my slowpoke connection it's really not worth it to download iTunes 3 but that OSX 10.2 Jaguar looks hella-cool. On the downside, they've gotten rid of iTools and with it goes my mac.com email. I've got until Sept. 30th to pay up for the new .Mac service or lose my email. Sha, right! Movin' to hotmail... I also saw Wayne's World on CityTV. Man that movie rules. Party on!
Sh*t! I had a lot of homework tonight... oh well... back to school. I had a spare today. Spares are cool... went to the village with Bateman... I like spares. I gotta go watch Dog Eat Dog now...

I've been back to school for a week now... and as unwilling as I was to go back, I am now coming to grips with my reality. As for the teacher situation I've got Mr. Wayne Tompkins for English, this guy is like the English guru... He's read just about anything you can name and I think he's old enough to have met Ernest Hemmingway, great guy really. For Geo, "Papa" Neil Mens, the Mensilator, a real cheerful guy, not as techno savvy as Hoel, and I'm kinda sad I don't get to use Hoel's new GeoNArc'ed out classroom but he's really a great teacher and we get to go to NYC this year, sweeeet. In the Theatre department, which btw is the greatest class ever in the history of classes, I've got Richard "Rick" Hood, who is also my house advisor, a really cool dude who even wrote a great play called Blowback (you can a review I wrote in my writing journal on this site). For French, sadly no Briglio (heyhey bubu!) but I've got Mme. Lowndes who I must say is very funny when she makes fun of the weaker french students... and they don't even understand. Math, good things can't last forever and neither can Shawzee but this year we've got a bigger class and a teacher called Griffin, really nice guy... kinda weird though, he made up his own number system where 11 is pronounced "10-dee one".... right. Finally Systems is good ol' Premek Hamr, the craziest crawfish-lovin' Czech you'll ever meet. He saved an endangered fish in Australia too! Good teachers anyways. Played some Golf today with the Cowie-man. He played well, and I well... I've had better. But Rosedale is pretty mutilated. The 1st and 18th are under construction so you start on ten go to 17 then play 2 to 9 and 10 and 11 again... and the rest of the course is aerated to heck. Not good green conditions. Well I can see I've rambled long enough so this is where I say till next time!

I had my first real rehearsal for Working today. It was one on one with Angie about my monologue. We worked on it a lot. She wanted me to stay for Ben's one and be a dog or something but then she changed her mind... which was good I guess. I think this is really gonna be a great play. It's got all the makings of a sweet show. I heard second hand that it was a huge flop on Broadway but hey, this is a grassroots deal, on Broadway they made it way too extravagant. We'll do it justice, just you wait. The first and second battle in winning this Halloween writing contest thang have been won. Antony said he liked my story, and he's running the contest, so yes that is a very good thing. Ben Sinclair didn't enter, so I've already achieved my goal of beating him this year... I went to the village Second Cup on my spare today with Bateman and Will. Had their new Vanilla deal cause they make it cheap on tuesday. Yeah it was good and I really have nothing else to talk about so yeah... Fresh Outs!

We had our read through for the musical "Working" today. It was good. I got to hear all the songs and finally read the script! I have an additional monologue with the one that we read for callbacks and I show up a couple other times with some small lines. For this play, that's a pretty good non-solo singing part. And thank goodness I don't have to solo! I'll let old Rich Ly and Clifford have that thank you very much. We also are trying to start our own Theater publication I got everything together me and Cowie will be the head editors and we have a lot of other people interested. We got Hood to agree to being faculty advisor. We went to Lorne Young and he thinks there might be too many publications and we should try to be part of Convergence! Just his suggestion, he says he'll talk to Arkin. But I think we'll end up getting a page of our own. 1) we don't like (most of) the Convergence people 2) they don't like us 3) we want it this way or we go rogue and do it anyways. Anyways, we're seeing a play tomorrow nite for ToK. Should be... interesting. No doubt I'll review it or something. And also, I should put up some more of my Blue Page stuff here... I really should. If I wasn't so lazy I would. HOLLA! I'm out.

As this weekend comes to a close I have to say that it really came out of nowhere to be like one of the best ones this year! It was just like last minute spontaeneous decisions to go see a movie with Cowie and then to go to this WAC Party (I gotta say it was one of the best sausage fests I've been to). It was just a sweet weekend one which both friday and saturday I was not sleeping until after 12:00. And if you see Panos laugh at him... he probably won't remember why.
Here we are in Geo. The stereo is pumping RUN-DMC. And Mens is talking to us. Shout outs to Brooker and Hudson behind me and Luca at my left. Working on my Geo Project. Oh yeah. Hard work.
To Luca: a much belated Big Ups! To Brooker and Hudson: big ups! to the max! that is all

I basically was just listening to random sample songs at Edward's (great store by the way) and I had to buy this one. Great CD. You will buy it now. Along with Forty Licks. You will buy both of them. MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM TURKEY -out

A lazy fall Saturday indeed. Played golf with Cowie. We both played wonderfully miserable. Had fun all the same. We talked a lot about how UCC Theatre season is officially "in". With Working being cast as we speak and Richard II doing rehearsals or something now it's definitely underway. Expect good things from these plays. Good things indeed. This has been getting some strange cult popularity around school. I guess it's a good thing Wai's site is way better to laugh at than mine. I haven't lost faith in this Gamecube of mine. Mario Sunshine... kickass game. Definitely a classic. This weeks urlLink PA is good. Check it out. good for a laugh. That's it for now. PEACE!
To Brooker and Hudson who may or may not be reading this. Sup? I am in Geo class right now and should be doing work but instead I'm updating this crazy site. PEACE.

It's amazing how for almost a whole term school can seem so easy with little or no work, only to start being overloaded constantly with work and extracurricular committments (which I love to death, but I seriously have too many).Yeah with big projects from all angles, my three publications (BluePage, Convergence, Quiddity), the play (we really havent had anything for a while though...), Improv team (affectionately known as the "team team"), and being manager for 1st B-ball (which is pretty cool), I'm a busy guy. I haven't gone home at 3:30 all week. I'm seeing this Young Co. Play tonite. I might write a review pending my mood. I usually do when I see a play. My birthday is coming up! Dec. 18... it's like a preview Christmas! But that also means exams are coming up which is waaaay not as cool as my birthday. I got 100% on my math test... ah studies. YAY! Have a sweet day peeps. I'm out. CH

"Nice car..." he says. We went to Gretzky's for some dinner. Baby back ribs... mmmmm. And then to Yuk Yuk's for a little entertainment. The comics there were f---ing hilarious! Went to the village for an evening coffee and back to matt's house to watch Henry V which turned into playing XBOX. By the time I was home it was 1:00 AM... a fun evening indeed.

Okay so get this... Derrick (the world's "greatest" stage manager) is telling me all week we have an all cast rehearsal tonight. And Ms. Foran says that too. And then I get there with like half the cast and it's apparrently cancelled. And apparrently "stage management" was supposed to send us an email. So I stayed til 5 for nothing. I ended up waiting for my 6 oclock ride home and doin some hw. But I mean, we have FIVE f%cking stage managers and one of them couldn't send an email saying "it's cancelled". Man, I saw a part of a Richard II rehearsal and they are sooo much more organised and better. They have one director and one SM. We have like 10 of each and nothing gets done... but it's cool cause I had HO-LEE-CHOW for dinner, and I'll be hungry in an hour... ice cream. Hudson... shout outs... I will find a way to make you pay for these cause you're getting too many free ones lately. I am soooo OUT! But it's all g

Saw a movie last night called "Igby Goes Down". It was an indie film. I used to hate those so much but I'm more cultured these days. I'm really glad that Will dragged us out to see it cause I probably wouldn't have seen it any other way. I really enjoyed it. It was funny, insightful, and interesting. Two thumbs up. Halloween came and went. I was volounteering down at the Gerrard K Club. They run a really good haunted house for the kids down there. Some kids were hella scared. It was our House Outreach. I hope I get a couple hours out of it... I needs em! Have a nice weekend!

Better give an Xmas update... and a b-day one too... yikes! Well I've been busy playing with my new stuff to post, and besides, I reiterate, who am I letting down? The like 2 people that read this? Happy Birthday to me! Yes, that's right, it's my birthday... and I'm sick as a dog :( So right, happy 16th birthday to me, but that doesn't cure this awful flu... shoulda got the shot. Ah well! I had to go down to school this morning to get my stuff out of my locker, they're gonna fumigate the place, kill the RATS! I gotta get a driver's license! With so much stuck at home sick time, I've been hangin out at this urlLink forum that Justin Wu set up. And truthfully it's pretty enjoyable! You should go hang out there... It's really well set up. ... wonder what I'm gonna get for my birthday? I'll keep ya posted. Outness!

I saw Branagh's new movie last night: Rabbit Proof Fence. I have to say his performance was phenomenal as usual. The rest of the movie was also very powerful. I thought it was moving and that the director did a very good job of creating symbols of power and conveying emotion without words. There were parts were a word wouldn't be uttered for several minutes on end, and these were some of the most emotional moments. I was especially impressed by the aboriginal actor who played the tracker, Moodoo. He said only one brief phrase that quite frankly I didn't understand what he said, but he carried himself with such a presence. It was like he was stone cold but you could see deep down that he had inner conflict. His air of seriousness was just amplified by his stone cold facial expression (I say expression because it rarely changed). The girls who played the runaways were very good considering it was their first time acting. The one thing that got me was how they would always run into these random people in the desert that gave them food and showed them directions. But hey, it's a true story. Really makes you think the kind of cruelty that went on in the world and hardly anyone knows about it. We had to see this movie at Canada Square which is an old skool theatre. No stadium seating, no big comfy chairs, small ass theatre and screen. But it was coo'. Cause it made me feel smarter seeing an intellectual film. HA! That's all.

Sup y'all. I made a coolness page about my favourite actor: Kenneth Branagh. You can check it out by going to the "random" section. Mme. Lowndes says that our generation has ruined the word random but I believe it's been given new life. RANDOM! I'm out.

3 down 3 to go. I have 2 exams this week. Systems and Theatre. This week is jokes! Possibly to two hackest courses in the school, with plenty of days off in between to prepare. Exams start tommorrow. Which is good and bad. Good because it means school is nearly over. Bad because Exams start tommorrow. This week is the worst. Then I have Geo the next monday and I am so out of there for Christmas. Which is also nice because Christmas and what I refer to as "Week Early Christmas" (my birthday) are just around the corner. Snatch , the latest flick from British director and Maddona husband Guy Ritchie, is the tale boxing promoters Turkish and Tommy who through a series of twisting and intricated plot structures become entangled in a squabble over an 84 carat diamond stolen by Franky Four Fingers (Benny Del Toro), that involves several "gangs", if you will, of the sleazy British underworld. The ensemble cast of actors you probably have never heard of (minus probably Brad Pitt) ably portrays the extremely stereotypical Jewish, Black, Pikey, and Russian gangs. Whether it's the incoherent babble of the Pikeys (think British hicks), or the hilarious incompetence of the blacks at robbery, Snatch keeps you laughing. And at the same time you become wrapped in the very complicated plot which is surprisingly easy to follow. Some very cleverly edited sequences, the car crash, the final boxing match, polish off what is a very funny and captivating film. Snatch has earned it's place among classic films such as Beavis and Butthead Do America and Zoolander on my official "Greatest Movies of All Time List" which I will post here some day.

It's one of those movie review posts so hang tight... Rob Marshall's Chicago has been called "Best Picture" by the Motion Picture Association of America, and now, for all it counts for, me too. Having seen an excellent broadway production of the play not two weeks earlier, I came in with some high expectations. I can now say that I am a huge fan of this play, movie, whatever. I love Chicago ! Chicago is simply a great movie. It's just got all the ingredients that makes a great film. The great story is already there (I mean it would be hard to fuck this one up, I mean, it's Chicago for christ's sake...). But you can't blame it all on Bob Fosse. Rob Marshall brings such a great vision to how this story should be brought to the screen. Chicago is way more than just a great play on film. The best elements of the film are things you simply could not do on the stage. And sure, it's an all-star cast but who'd-a-thunk these actors could pull off such great performances. I was a little underwhelmed by Renee Zellweger but she was still good (her best performance by far was Jerry McGuire!). Queen Latifah was perfect for the part of Mama, just perfect. Catherine Zeta-Jones and Richard Gere just had that "I never knew they could sing/dance/act so well" dynamic. And, wonderful as always was hometown favourite: Colm Feore. Bringin' the "Feore Factor" to his role as Assisstant DA Harrison. Do I have to tell you the music was good? Because it was. After seeing numbers like "Cell Block Tango" and "We Both Reached For The Gun"(the puppet song) it becomes very clear that this is the year's best picture. Great soundtrack by the way. The way the film switched between the "real world" and the fantasy "vaudeville world" was so appropriate and done very well. Kudos to director Rob Marshall. Okay and for the real "big question" about Chicago... Yes, it might be "gay" for a guy who is overly concerned with his masculinity to see this movie while not on a date but hey, if you can appreciate a good musical as much as me it shouldn't matter. If you can't, then you better hope you can find a girl who hasn't seen Chicago yet because this film is absolutely not to be missed on the big screen. 5 stars. signing off.

Well the academic year has come to an end which means it is time to announce the winner(s) of " The Tool of the Year ". The Tool of the Year is based on the following factors, sheer toolness (trying to be cool to other people, the longevity of their tooliness, etc.), stupidity, and of course the Oompa-Loompa factor (on a scale of 1-10). By the way if you are on this list, do not complain or do anything like that, you brought it upon yourself, and I did not come up with this list, it was a judges panel, we feel that these people embody all of the characteristics that tools stand for. So if you are offended, sympathy is in the dictionary between shit and syphallus, now shut up! Here they are: 1. Michael Stephens 2. James Ricci 3. Luca Corrente 4. Sang Ik Song 5. Max Torokvei 5. David Canella Normally we don't have a tie for 5th place, but this year we've been forced to make an exception. Ok Heres the run down: 1. Michael Stephens: Is this any great surprise? Cause if it is you need to be slapped across the face (after all he did take the award home last year)! His Oompa Loompa ranking is a 16, the only person more Oompa Loompa like than Stephens is the Oompa Loompa god himself, he is the epitome of the Oompa Loompa species itself. Now the infamous Clothos incident was one of the worst incidents of the year, and everyone knows about that. However, the worst demonstration of his tooliness was way back in September/October, when Dr. Churchward was casting KR2. Apparently Stephens thought that he was 'the best actor' who auditioned and therefore would get a major role. He believed so firmly in this that he quit First Football before he had been cast, it turns out that our beloved director, Dr. Churhward had heard from Angie Silverstein (of BSS) of how Stephens called her a bitch and how she cried. So, no part for Stephens, no First Football, and now, Tool of the Year! 2. James Ricci: Some of you may ask, why Ricci? Well first of all his has an Oompa Loompa factor of 8 which is no Michael Stephens but pretty damn high, plus he has nickname like Nescafe, which is just weird. Anyway if you had been in our theatre class this entire year, you would now be acquainted with this huge tool. Plays like, Richard Corry (which AK insists that Ricci wrote for him, and I believe AK cause he isn't a tool), The Day They Killed a Dove (the gayest play known to man, ever, I mean what the fuck is up with those falcons!), his messing up of our set design project, and his Hummer H2 driver, 'Driver'. Now I had suggested that he be the tool of the year, but it was deemed by the judges panel that he sheer toolness had only been at its peak for a maximum of two terms. But what a fucking tool! 3. Luca Corrente: One word, GINO! I mean the guy keeps saying that everyone will buy his car once they see the Italian Job! The kid knows nothing about cars and makes up the biggest automotive related stories ever (a big no-no by the way). Nevermind the Oompa Loompa factor (which is a 5), Luca is just a big fucking tool. 4. Sang Ik Song: Not only one of the most annoying kids in the school, but just an all round tool, mostly for the shit he does in English class, but basically he smokes alot of pole. Table Tennis, Ping Pong? I don't give a fuck! To top it all off he has an Oompa Loompa factor of 7. 5: Max Torokovei: Why Torokvei? He changes his mind so much! He can be a nice guy to you one minute, but then he'll turn around a be a complete dick to you the next minute. Oompa Loompa factor; a 3. Sorry man but if you see this, you brought it upon yourself. 5: David Canella: Not only did this skater punk piss the fuck out of JJ for the WAC shit he pulled, but he actually tried to become Head Steward. Now everyone is allowed to run for Head Steward, but he went around saying to everyone why he was going to win, and to top it all off he tried to 'bribe' people for votes by letting them push him around, big tool! Oompa Loompa factor; a 7. Well I'd love to here your responses to this list I think it embodies all of the thoughts of our grade. Let me know what you think. "Man what a tool!" "You call him a morron and he just sits there grinning moronoly!"

The big day has finally arrived! I have kept you all in suspense through the first three parts of the Birth of Cooplander, now let's see how strong a pay off you will all receive. Cooplander: Birth of a Legend He enters the room shuts the door and quickly strips his clothes off, eventually he is naked as the day he entered the world. He is about to start the tanning bed when he remembers all of the signs outside that said to keep his underwear on while tanning, so he just locks the door. He starts the machine, jumps in and closes the top of the bed. He puts in his cd in the stereo and just relaxes. Man this is just so damn calming, I could do this all the time. Suddenly, it didnt seem so hot anymore, actually it felt extremely cold. Even though his eyes were closed he could still tell the lights were on. What the f--- is this? At that very moment he was overcome with extreme pain, a pain he had never felt before in his life. SHIT! all of the veins on his body were bulging at the surface of his skin, and as the pain increased his eyes instinctively open leaving his eyes open to the harmful UV rays of the bed. HOLY SHIT!! F--- SOMEBODY HELP!!!! The girl from the front was trying to open the door, but he had locked it earlier to hide his nakedness from the world. All of a sudden the pain and coldness is gone, but he cant hear anything on the other side of the door. Miss? nothing, no sound Miss!? he suddenly realizes what probably happened and is about to get up when the pain returns at least three times as bad. HOLY F---!!!! then everything goes black When he wakes up again the tanning bed is off, he gets out of the bed and checks his watch, he had been out for 15 minutes. What the f--- was that? He scans the room and sees nothing out of the ordinary. Maybe I dreamed it. Yeah thats it a dream. Then he notices the mirror in the room, and to his shock realized that he is changed. His hair looked like it had grown. He ran his hands through his hair and realized it had, it also had gel in it somehow. Then he realized just how tanned he had become. This does not happen with just one tanning session. No Way. One more look reveals more changes, his thin frame had not become a very good-looking toight one. His muscles were also much harder and larger, ALL of the muscles. Finally he looked up for one last time and realized the drastic change in his face. For one his acne was entirely gone, not a spot, there werent even anymore acne or chicken pox scars. As well, his face seemed just a bit better looking than before. Damn, Im beautiful! Sir are you ok in there? Suddenly he realized that the woman was still outside and probably still scared. He unlocked the door and opened it up. The womans face was extremely pale. She looked as if she had seen a ghost. He simply smiled at her and her face light up. With his confidence high and his clothes off he decided to go a step further Hi my names Cooplander Adam Cooplander. Would you please step into my office she took his hand and entered room #6. 45 minutes later they both emerged. THE END Well finally it's over! You now know the story of my emergence as the most beautiful man at UCC. If any of you would like to hear about the further adventures of Cooplander please e-mail me at adam_cooper@ucc.on.ca By the way if any of you find any of this scene homoerotic than you can go suck on a log. "When I look in the mirror, can't believe what I see, tell me who's that funky dude, staring back at me?" - Weezer - The Good Life see y'all on the flip side from the weird one ps heh heh Boston Red Sux heh heh

Last night in lieue of starting my exam studying (which I will do any minute now, i swear) I went to the Jays game with my good pals Eric Estey (who generously provided the tickets), Bateman, and Cowie. Fun times, my friend. Unfortunately we didn't find Jason Morris or Ian Harris (who we figured would have been blazing on the 500 level). But fortunately the Jays totally thrashed the Boston Red Sox. And our Bostonian friends in attendance (aka the old dude sitting right in front of us) were not too pleased at our constant heckling... "Yeah, more like Boston Red Sux!" "Trot Nixon? More like Trot back to the dugout... cause your out!" "Johnny Damon? More like Johnny Lame-on!" and various other comments including the ever present "more like, you suck at baseball" were yelled at the Sox players from our great seats pretty close to up front. No fly balls came our way though. I did get to help the Big E pick out his brand new Toronto baseball jersey and hat, as well I picked up a "pimpin" old skool Jays logo flat brim hat... i must say it's pimp toight. Well, it's all about the TBJ, Jays rule, Baseball north and all that hoowah! Peace out. (still tryin to find the origin of Peace Out for Wayne)

An excellent query by Bishop on the theme to rice rockets. THEY ARE THE LARGEST PIECES OF SHITE ON THE PLANET. Luca think's they're good, and so does Torokvei. Need I say more? Speaking of Luca, and therefore Will, I feel that they should be removed from the blog, just based upon their lack of involvement, I mean Cooper posts more in a week, than they have since (Well since they've been on the site). An interesting story about Torokovei btw, he has ordered a Chevy Trailblazer, because his mom thinks that a car is 'too showy'. Well last time I checked, getting a $40,000 anything when you are 16, is pretty f-cking showy. In response to Hudson's query, the new Maserati is amazing. Having been purchased by Ferrari's parent company Fiat, the new Maserati is essentially a Ferrari. It has the same transmission as the Ferrari 360 Modena (the paddle shift dealies), enough room for a few sets of golf clubs, and a small backseat area. No doubt that you will see more of them once they get their GT Racing program off the ground (they just got a Formula 1, engine developer to help them out). They say that the 3200 (the Maserati) is targeted towards owners of Porsche 911s, so you should compare it to that. My personal opinion is that it is one of the best cars on the street today.

"Who's coming into my lair? said the spider to the fly" God Tompkins is a genius Anyways the wait is over... well at least for the 3rd part of the Birth of Cooplander the 4th will arrive on Saturday Cooplander: Birth of a Legend Part 3 We now return to our main character entering the tanning salon unaware of what awaits him inside. He enters and doesnt see anyone around, he waits for a few minutes twiddling his thumbs before loses his patience, Hello? Is anybody there? Coming! out of the back comes one of the most beautiful women that Adam had ever seen. As she approaches the counter Adam says Hi I was wondering if I could purchase some time in your bed." "Huh?" The girl gives him an annoyed look "I mean tanning bed, yeah tanning beds. Yes, you can schedule an appointment in any of our many TANNING beds. Great, how much? Well actually we have a few deals if you look at this here. We have 10 sessions for $60 and 5 sessions for $25. Those sound very appetizing, but I think Ill only go once then see if I like it. Sure those are only $10 a session, do you want to go in now? That sounds great! hands the girl a $20. And 10 your change and you can go right in to tanning room 6 for 20 minutes. Thanks! Adam walks towards room #6, but doesnt notice the girls face go extremely pale as he enters the room, as if something had scared the crap out of her. What's going to happen? What scared the girl? What is Kinkead going to do? Is Cooper going to get a good tan? All these questions and more will be answered next time in the finale of Cooplander: Birth of a Legend "If you want it, you can have it, but you have to learn to reach up their and grab it." Weezer - Photograph Lates from the Weezer lover

Mwa haahahahahaaha. (evil laugh)

Yeah Hudson, I'm sorry but Cody looked like such a flaming queer when he was doing his little dance "baby if you give it to me" the worst was that he kept doing it, thinking it was cool. Pooner's too nice to shut him down... I'm just glad my mentee was not there...

Okay Bateman, to clarify my list is my top 5 "of right now" meaning what i'm really into listening to at the moment. If I had to make an "of all time list" then yes, the Stones would be no.1, okay well let's do an all time list: 1. The Rolling Stones 2. Run-D.M.C. 3. Dire Straits 4. N.W.A. 5. The Beatles happy? well i dont give a crap... and the Escalade rules, and some day I will drive one with fly ass 20 inch rims... (dreams of cruising in future Escalaaaaaaade) Anyways I had a good, original idea for a six line, so here it is: "Friday Night Idyllity" Scene 1- (The streets of the Fo' Hill. Ian is decked out in Burberry Visor and usual gear) IAN: (on cell phone) Honestly you are the dumbest kid... homosauce... what? Yeah well anyways have a good weekend if I don't see you. (ladies walk by, Ian straightens his posture and puts a wide smile on his face) Hey, how are you? (pause) (points to his visor) Yeah you like it? It's fake! (pause) Well... my mom thinks it's cool, and so does george... and cowie, they think it's hella tight... call me. (pause, watches them walk away) Who needs them anyways. (dials le numero d'une jeune fille on the cell phone, waits for answer) Hey there! It's Ian by the way. What's that? Your Waiting.. for what? Oh you hate me? That's not very nice... anyways, I was wondering if there was a party going on tonight? You're at your grandparents house? family gathering, eh... I'll bring the keg. (pause) hello? (she has hung up.) fuck. (another young woman walks by) Hey, I hear you broke up with that dead weight boyfriend, so I guess you'll be going out with me soon? Yeah? No? I'll take that middle finger as a yes! (pause) I wonder what Cooper is doing... Scene 2- (Tanning Salon. Cooper Enters and approaches the front desk) COOPSTER: Hey Megan, I see I've come during your latenight shift, funny how that always happens... even though you changed your shift hours about four times on me... that Craig isn't half the front desk attendant as you. So is my usual bed ready for my weekly friday night bronzing? (pause) okay, I'll wait. (sits down in waiting room. A fly chick comes out from one of the tanning rooms) Hayley, isn't this a coincidence, how we always come here at the same time? I see you're looking nice and tanned, the bronze delicousness is exciting! (pause) what do you mean restraining order? (she leaves) Whatever with her... there are way hotter ladies tanning au naturel just like the Coopster at this very moment. (Cooper gets up when front desk lady isn't looking. goes over to a tanning room marked "occupied by one of the hot ladies of tanning" opens door a crack looks in. We hear a female scream.) Free Tanned for life? Sweet! Oh wait that's a B... "Banned for Life!" Whatever... there are way flyer ladies at the other tanning salon i use, always carry a backup... oh yeah... The Coopster. Wonder what Bish is doing.... Scene 3- (Bish's basement. Bish is playing PS2 or something.) BISH: Why does everyone think I'm a sketchball because I play Tiger Woods PGA 2003 in my spare time... i don't get it. What is a sketchball? A ball of sketch? Preposterous... Wow. I think I'm going to give H-kins an unprecedented 5 klondikes for this very play of which I am a part. Or at least enough to edge out Hudson for the Ice Cream. So delicious... (dreams of klondikes) I wonder what Huddy's up to? Scene 4- (UCC basement, changerooms next to the Lett Gym.) HUDSON: (Opens door of changeroom from inside, peeks head out. Gives a thumbs up and an intoxicating smile as if to say "SCORE!".) Wait'll horkypoo hears about this... (Hudson then puts his index finger up to his lips and quietly goes:) Sssssshhhhhhh! (then he goes back into the change room for untold adventures. wink wink.) (after a few seconds passing, a brown janitor walks by humming the tune to Punjabi MC.) Scene 5- (Horkins's room. Chris is on the computer, his tangerine iMac, writing this very play.) CHRIS: Hmmm.... I seem to have run out of creative juice, and this play has nothing to do with the subject matter it should... (Eureka! raises a pointed finger, lightbulb appears above head) (Chris Picks up the phone dials an unseen number.) Scene 6- (WT's House, Wayne is sitting in his rumpus room in a smoking jacket and bear feet slippers, smoking a pipe, perhaps even a bubble pipe. He has his usual look of "out of it-ness" on his face. His old fashioned, and i mean Alexander Graham bell probably made it, telephone rings. He answers.) CHRIS (over phone): Sir it's me... uh... Auwal, yeah Auwal, from class. Do you, uh... like anyone in class, like more than a friend? What about that Horkins? I hear he has a blog that he wants you to post on... in fact he is sending you priveleges to post right now... yeah... as a token of affection... and he really likes your exam review package. I mean... yeah... wanna post? WAYNE: Well Owl... I can't see why you're inviting me instead of Chris, I didn't know he was so shy. Well, Mr. Eeeesa Odeeedeee! Lovely name... like Samuel Taylor Coleridge... so many syllables. (drifts off, then wakes up again) Well then, If I really want to be a true scholar of the internet, Owl, I should join Chris's blog and maybe download some l33t Snes Romz from your own website. Alright then, don't think I don't research my classmates, and btw, I owned you in CounterStrike last night. (click, Wayne hangs up.) THE END. Okay, yeah, i think this will be the last one... cause, yeah. and it may seem like it has 7 lines but one carry's over two scenes, it's the same character. So yeah... Anyways it's getting late and the ducks are losing which is totally not good. And Simple Plan is quality pop-punk/emo/whatever and they're french canadian which only adds to the pleasure. Peace out homeys.

Mariah Carey "I know what u want" all i have to say is ....wow..what was he thinking..oh man

You've seen the first two parts of Cooplander's Birth and now it is time to tell you all of the adventures in WT's English class, in a six line play. I am not a literary genius like Hudson, or a comedic like Horkins, or repetitive like J-Roc, but I am weird so we'll see if that works in my favour. (Scene is Wayne Tompkins IBI English class. The WT is currently taking attendance.) Tompkins: OK everyone your Family Memoirs are due today, but I must take the attendance first. Bateman hmm nothing, Bishop ah there you are! Cooper Cooper (Cooper is sleeping on his desk) oh he must not be here! Ah well this takes too long Ill just do it after Tim comes. Now your family memoirs are due today and as some poet said that I cant remember the name of Im coming for them. This wont be a problem because you all have them done, yes? (collective groan from the class) I think I will collect from some random order, Prene? Do you have your family memoirs? You do not? Well Im sure you shall bring it to me soon Tompkins: Ah Mathers yours is complete! Lets see the first one, How My Psychologist keeps me from going postman on everyone Seems interesting Robert. And Awal? Oh he isnt here. Ha ha ha, that is funny! Nowers? Nowers: Yes sir this is a study into the idiocy shown by the Bush administration, and how we are all going to die because of the US. I know I was suppoused to write a family memoirs but that isnt as interesting as how we are all going to die! Tompkins: Yes Cooper where is yours? Oh hes still asleep I shant awake him, Im sure he needs it, for we dont know why he is asleep. (at this moment an elephant hands Prene his assignment) Ah Prene your assignment how wonderful! (turns to chris) Chris shall we be receiving your essay today? Horkins: (chris squirms in his desk until he thinks up an amazing idea) Well no sir, but I think that a much better way of marking me would be to analyze my amazing site Flounder Online! It is much better than any memoir assignment and if you like it you can join and post among the chosen few! Tompkins: Well that sounds splendid Chris! I could finally give my knowledge to those who can appreciate it. Id love to hear all of your opinions on the Silken Tent a masterpiece of a poem. As well, I would love to see your Family Memoirs assignment on this site Chris because you cannot squirm your way out of this assignment. Thats all Folks! If that didn't beat Hudsons then... it probably wasn't that good. Remember part 3 of the birth of Cooplander, be ready for anything. Just a few more days until the finale. "You're just a teenage industry." Blur - Crazy Beat A stressed out studying tanned man P.S. Its fun to make fun of yourself, you should all give it a try

Love the shit about WTs computer, the pronunciation of Awal's name, etc. Little things that we all think and never say. I love the attention to detail like titling your play. I'm deliberating whether or not to give you a mark as high as hudson's. I went back to read them both over and over again. Hudson's narrowly edged you out once again. 4.49 klondikes. Cooper- write a play before i tell all the ladies u pick up at the tanning salon how weird you really are. Haha man jks. bish

Bateman enough with the gay jokes man. Come on it works the first few times, but come on I think you can come up with some new and interesting ways to make fun of me. I sure as hell give you enough material in English class, just look at everyone else's plays, not many of them use gay jokes or innuendos. The only reason I ran with this Cooplander gimmick (invented by David Riesman) is because I like to make people laugh. People were entertained so I just thought what the hell. So I tan who cares, its a hell of a way to meet women, you have no idea how many fine ladies tan. I've picked up a few and damn are they hot! I admit I like tanning, but the women is what kept me coming back. If you can come up with an easier way to meet beautiful ladies, please fill me in 'cause I'd really like to know. By the way Bishy I wrote this entire story in a couple hours because I was bored and I am aware that my story and the way I act is a little weird, but I do it on purpose, as I said I like to entertain people. Sorry for getting on a rant guys, but I do have some self respect. I ain't no dart board. The quotes are for fun too, I enjoy putting them up, as I said I like to entertain you guys. Sorry Bish you just got caught in the line of fire, Bateman you can't say you didn't have this coming. Be careful who you insult Bateman, one day someone's gonna kick your ass. "Action may not always be happiness, but there is no happiness without action." You thought I was gonna stop with these? You will still see my next installment on Wednesday, I was just a little pissed off that's all, I just needed to get that off my chest. Cooplander signing out and expecting a backlash

Scene: WTs class. Bishop: Ok sir, the following people don't have it done because I've been snooping around all day collecting names, Cooper, Nowers, Awal, Sang-Ik, Bosco, Horkins and Bateman. Bateman: And just to add to that sir, Mathers is smoking at the back of the class. WT: Bateman shut up, no one likes a tattle tale, you now have a 2. And, Bishop, it appears that we have a Caesarian Soothsayer in the midst, very good you get a 7. Ok Cooper, now that you have finally handed in your assignment, how about you read some of it for us. Cooper: Ok, its called the birth of Cooplander. When I was young, I displayed many blattantly homo-erotic tendencies, I was placed in hockey leagues and eventually my parents thought that they had gone away. They were wrong. Everywhere I went, I felt like bending the cute waiter over, or flopping onto my knees in Mr. Arkin's class. It seemed that everyone in Toronto was commiting fashion crimes that no one seemed able to prevent it, except for one woman trapped in a man's body, Cooplander! My alter ego naturally. Suddenly there were accounts in Etobickoe (or however the f-ck you spell it) of a man, with an all over tan where in a thong, running around saving everyone with poor fashion sense. The secret to the Cooplander's magical powers is that he has to recharge them at the tanning salon. Now you know the full story of Cooplander. Horkins: Sir, before you give us your eloquent comments about Mr. Cooper's piece, I would like to say this: If you were as appauled and revolted at this as I was, then please post your comments on my 'weblog', or 'blog' horkypoo.cjb.net, or if you prefer, flounder.cjb.net WT: This is an interesting proposal Chris, but in truth I rather enjoyed Cooper's piece. And Scene Now Bishop the only reason you are mentioned is because you narked me out in class today. Second, Hudson, there is no reason why ppl smoke, of the few butts I had, I found that I enjoyed the taste more than anything, but it is something that you will have to find for yourself, and yes it was a really big/bad f-ck up on my part. And Nowers, I don't smoke. Third, Cooper, shut up about your damn Cooplander BS, it only inspires me to wirte plays.

Play in a Play in a Play... Scene- WTs Class, Wayne is droning on and on about a Robert Frost poem, probably two looking at two or something. As usual no one is listening to him. J-F Boucher pretends to listen, as does the Dougler. Prennay is being his normal weird self. Cooper is curled up in his golf shirt, lying back to the full extent on his crappy green school chair, head tilted back, eyes closed. WAYNE: And you see, you have to know Two Looking at Two, inside and outside... if you want to be truly versed in the literature of Robert Frost, outside these walls at least. Take the word all (pause) ALL.... That must be all. (pause) see how powerful this is? Cooper, whats your take on this poem? COOPER: Uuuugh! (still asleep) (everyone laughs at cooper) WAYNE: Well I see this is rather boring for you chaps, so its time for a new approach. I got an electronic mail from my friend in the math department Steve Griffin about a website known as Flounder Online, where a number of you chaps post some six line plays about this class. And I thought we could give this website a visit so everybody gather around the computer, but dont touch it unless your name is Wayne Tompkins. (everyone gathers around Wayne at the computer) DOUG: Hey, Bateman! I made out with Meg McNicol, not Cooper! (pause. everyone looks at Doug weirdly) I mean... yeah it was Cooper. AUWAL: Hey, no one ever mentioned me in their plays, alright! Kung Fu Kenneth! WAYNE: Thats because you never come to class, Owl... which is why I cant pronounce your name correctly! (sneezes) damn this hayfever! Anyways, Ill be expecting posting priveleges from you boys soon. I hope my typewriter at home can access it... END SCENE! okay, if this does not cut it, then I quit....

Hello all! Just returned from an intense tanning session. I'd like to congratulate myself for receiving a first team tie for golf. But I think I know why all of you are reading this... to read PART 2 of Cooplander Birth of a Legend ! And here it is the second installment of an epic saga. Cooplander Birth of a Legend Part 2 In the year of 1998 Harry Kinkead was the premier male model. Magazines clamoured for his services, he fetched upwards of $30000 a photo shoot. Considering that he did about 250 shoots a year he was very well off. But he had become addicted to the fame, the drugs and the women. He let his workout program tail off and as he grew older his world-renowned six-pack from heaven began to disappear. As well, he had found that marijuana was not strong enough for him, he moved off into coke, than crack cocaine, then finally heroin. Well this combined with his eating habits sent him in a spiral downwards. By 2002, he could no longer fetch the $30000 photo shoots; he was now at max a $10000 per photo shoot model. Angered at being surpassed by others and ignored by the major modeling labels he turned to the Italian mafia. They were able to make offers that the major magazines were unable to turn down and soon Kinkeads modeling career was alive once again. But being apart of the mafia was dangerous and Kinkead was never a very smart man. He began to ignore requests by the mob and eventually they grew quite tired with his antics. On the night of November 27th, 2003, he was ambushed after a party and murdered by Johnny hard hands Stamboli. It has now been 6 months since he was killed. Unfortunately, his spirit cannot rest, at least not until he achieves revenge on those who wronged him. He has looked all this time for someone that he can possess that has the beauty to succeed in the model world. He now knows who that man is, that man is Adam Cooper. Thanks all for reading the second installment of my story. Part 3 will be released on Wednesday and the end of our hero's epic struggle will be shown to the masses on Saturday. A closed mind is like a closed book; just a block of wood. - Chinese Proverb - Stay tuned Wednesday... snootchie bootchies!! Cooplander garcon model

In this, it's fourth splendid year, and penultimate outing in it's current format, the deserving team finally came out on top. Yo my homies what's up? I'll tell you what's up the first part of the birth of cooplander. Yes you will all be told in a four part series of my transition from Adam Cooper to Cooplander. So sit back and enjoy. Cooplander, Birth of a Legend It was a day like any other, the sun was shining, people playing in the park and there wasnt a cloud in sight. Unfortunately, for one person this would not be a day like any other. For him it would be a day with tragic consequences, a day that he would never forget. Our main character right now is sitting at home right now playing his favourite game, NHL 2003 when the phone suddenly rings. He picks up the phone, Yello? Its Andrew Yo man wat up? I went tanning man Huh? Ya man, you know the fake bake. Why To look hot man, you gotta look super fine for the ladies Whats it like? Man you just lay there and sleep for like 20 minutes, its sick man, you should go Is it that good? Yeah man its amazing you should go Sure why not? Sounds fun Yo man I gotta jet, gotta get artificially stimulated I see well Ill see ya later. Payce. What Adam did not know about that conversation was that that was not Andrew. Andrew had never set foot in a tanning salon before. No, this was someone else, someone he would get to know very well in the future. Adam continues to play his game, but his friends advice keeps finding its way into his thoughts. He had questions, but was unable to reach his friend. He just kept thinking, would it give me melanoma? What about cataracts? Yeah, but I hate being super white, I do want a tan. Ah f--- it Im going, whats there to lose, its tanning. Adam shuts off the computer, grabs his keys and jumps into his car. He pulls out of his driveway and is own his way. Within minutes he arrives at a mall, this mall also has a small tanning salon tucked into the back corner. As he walks to the salon he fails to realize how conspicuously few people there are in the mall. This is as a result of the same person that called him over an hour earlier. Actually to call him a person would be a mistake because this was no man that Adam was dealing with, it was so much more. Well there you go guys the first part in the series. By the way thank you Chris, I am a bronzed god. Bateman one question, who the hell is Meg McNicol? "I love you like a fat kid loves cakes" Fitty Cent - 21 Questions Signing out Cooplander, PAYCE!
"And Scene" Okay Bateman, learn to spell... I'm sorry I fell off my chair laughing at this one. Dude the A key is no where near the E ya goof! ah... sorry but that sh-t is jokes. LOL. Paice.

The past two days I have spent at the chillinest killinest Model Parliament in Ontario, the world famous OMP. Representing the fine people of Haliburton Ontario. I had a fun time with our honorable brown premier Farouk "Fa-Rule" Hussein. Anyways... Okay, this is my new entry into the play thing. "A Query" Scene: (Tompkins's Class. Wayne has not yet arrived. Chris Enters notices on the white board a list of names "A. Cooper, B. Fan, G. Campbell" under "late assignments". Quickly he scribbles "post on flounder.cjb.net, a blog, post there!" and then under it "S. McKell" Chris has a laugh at his work and sits down.) Bateman: (very upset, grabs Chris) JJ? What the f---? Honestly you are the dumbest kid. You dumb little f---! (Chris looks very sad. Ian suddenly becomes jovial, but still maintains his kung fu grasp on Chris's shoulderblade.) I'm just joking man, that was jokes man. (angry again) But look, that's my bit okay, you have to find your own shit, I started that along with "Aw-Yeeeaah!" and "From Russia with the Lovebone, Muhf-ckuh!" (happy) just jokes flounder, JJ, homosauce, softserve... (laughs hysterically at self) Chris: Okay... Nowers: Why do you do this shit Horkins, you're just like the f-cking US Government who are all evil Oil Barons with Oil rigs named after them. Why won't they legalise pot? Because they are evil and the only reason they are in Iraq is because they want to take over the world, but they can't... because they're evil. I am better than all of you. (spits on floor disgustedly.) Mathers: (quietly on the phone in the corner) yes... hello? Kid's Help Phone? I'm seriously considering killing everyone in my English class a la Columbine because they're always mocking the way I speak, Mr Tompkins says I have a beautiful reading voice dammit, I also have a beautiful crazy voice inside my head telling me to KILL KILL KILL! (this last part is screamed very loudly... everyone stops and looks and Rob who's grip tightens on a formerly hidden handgun) Wayne: (enters, removes beret, looks at board, looks at Rob) Ah, Robert, are you rehearsing a play for us? Puppy Months? (laughs hysterically in his breathless fashion, no one else laughs) And what is this nonsense on the board? Bateman? (Ian shakes his head no) I know it was you. Please erase it. (Ian gets up and solemnly goes and wipes it out muttering something) Well, I actually already know a lot about this "Flounder Online" being a fellow Irishman, I have Chris's Gift of The Blarney! I can read minds! And I can tell that blogging might also help our troubled friend robert here, yes? (Rob shakes head yes, reluctantly) I knew it would. Bateman, here's job for you, i want you to write me ten posts for Chris's blog for me to post. And Rob, I haven't received your Hemingfrost assignment, it's 50% off... (Mathers gets really angry and fires a shot into the ceiling, it is very loud.) Cooper: (awakens quickly) Whuh-what! (jumps up but falls over because his entire upper body is curled up in his golf shirt. Cooper lands with a thud.) oooowie! (everyone laughs, including Wayne, who was so amused he gave the class a spare, and they all lived happily ever after.) THE END

Posting on the Blog; Revised Version. A word of warning to the easily offended. The views of this play do not reflect the views of its author, it is a satirical depiction of English class and is meant to be taken lightly, and should in now way offend you. If you are easily offended then just turn away now, just don't complain to me about how you were offended or something like that. Setting: WTs classroom on a hot spring day. We have started reading our family memoirs. Sang Ik is reading. Sang Ik: Its when I was eating his dog that I realized that I shouldn't smyte him for confusing ping-pong with the artform of tennis. He then said, "Just get the hell away from me, you are so annoying!" Cooper: (out of his sleep) What? Fuck you! I'm not gay, its perfectly heterosexual to go to a tanning salon and to tan in the nude. At least thats what my mom says. WT: Very good Sang Ik, you said that you were from New Brunswick, yes? Alright then. (dramatic pause) in that case you get a 7++++. Your turn Scott and then we'll have Chris. Nowers: Ok, I tool more of a narrative approach for mine. Here goes.... (reading from his assignment) My MDX rules! I wanted a Mustang but my girlfriend has one, and there's a problem with its Fuel Injectors so that if floor it, it messes up the engine and shit, which I can't have cause my summer job is going to be drag racing guys. I now can use my friend's Porsche 944-S2X5R77RR which is souped up beyond belief. It is tuned to perfection by some guy named Boris downtown. It now has over 7000 horsepower. I got pulled over by a cop once for speeding and I told him to fuck off because I am the best driver in the world and I can drive as fast as I want, no one can beat me!... Ok Im done. Chris: Ok, I'm sort of improvising a bit cause I haven't handed mine in yet, so here goes... Its called a blog, short for weblog, it is so good it makes me crap my pants. I love it with my entire body (including my bum-bum). Everyone of my friends is a part of it. There has been one aspect of improvement that has eluded it for sometime now. Sir, Mr. Tompkins, we would be honored if you would join our 'blog' to post some of your insightful insight into the wonders of poetry and jazz. WT: Well Chris that's a very interesting proposal. Unfortunately I am unable to do so, because of my damn hayfever. And Scene Well there you go Bishop, another revised edition, hopefully with ever passing English class I am able to create a new one that is even better than before. Say it Bubbles, Say it! I ain't ever been so frisky in my entire life!

"A Modest Proposal" A comedy in six lines Scene: R. Wayne Tompkins's English classroom just after his favourite english class has let out. Wayne sits in his big comfy chair looking lamentably at a pile of World Lit papers from one of his other less favourite classes. The class begins to leave as the "softcore" students (ie Bosco, Cooper, et al) rush to get to the LDH and score the last Klondike cone. The Hardcore students take the time to pack their bags and wish WT a happy weekend (it's a friday last period btw). BATEMAN: Bye sir, have a nice weekend! By the way, are there any Jazz concerts or documentaries I would have no interest in but I'm asking you about to be a brown-noser going on this weekend? WAYNE: Sadly no... I plan to spend my weekend writing poetry and perhaps listening to some old records of Neil Armstong... no one tickled the ivory plains like he did... mmmyes? Wait, that was Louie Armstrong. I should have know, I do have several paintings of him in my bedroom... and bathroom. Alright, have a good weekend Ian, I'll be expecting your Frost paper soon, myes? It's 50% off as it stands. Run along then. (Ian exits. Chris, the last student left in the class approaches him.) CHRIS: Hey sir. WAYNE: Ah, Mr. Horkins, my favourite student... ah it is a pleasure indeed. What can I do for you? CHRIS: Well, uh... I was wondering. I have this website, a blog actually, weblog, It's like you make posts and stuff. A bunch of guys from class are a part of it. Like Hudson and Bishop, and er... Bateman... We were all wondering if maybe you would want to post sometimes. Maybe talk about what it's like to be a teacher, share some poetry, talk about jazz or what Jason Morris got on his Extended Essay... If you want the offer is on the table. Mr. Tompkins. For you to join our blog. So... do you uh... want to.... join our blog? Sir? WAYNE: (rudely awakens) mwhat? sorry, drifted off there. What were you saying? THE END.

First off, I'm sorry and I feel shame. 5 days since my last post, since my entrance into the blog I have been able to update on a consistent basis, but over the last 5 days I have no excuse for not posting other than creative bankruptcy. But never fear my friends for my mind has hit upon a mine of information as large as Harris's private stash. I am going to talk about 3 different things, firstly: a near accident with my car (not the old lady, I have no recollection of that event), some rap/poem rhyming and lastly and lastly a hillarious story from work :) Look at the format boys! Give 'em somethin' that they want to see and hint at it in the intro, oh yeah! English baby. WHOOOOOO!!! Oh it's true, its damn true. (KA best ever boys) I have no idea about this old lady incident, sounds more like my friend GC (just think about it you'll know who that is) I'm never getting in the car with him. Anyways, this story starts about 1 month ago or so. So far on this day we've inhaled our fair share of a foreign substance (just guess) and there were about 7 people in my car and I was driving them all home. I'm driving along Eglinton and I'm trying to figure out which way to go and I finally decide to take the 427 South to drop off my friend's girl. As I'm heading towards the on-ramp and I kind of phase out (side effect of my favourite substance) and I did not realize the speed that I was taking the ramp, I did not think about this until I see the suggested speed for the ramp... 40 kmh and I look at the speedometer. "OH SHIT!!!" I am going 80 kmh and I'm in a 2000 explorer (flips easily) I'm not thinking too well so as I'm turning on the ramp i try to brake and slow down, but this just causes me to skid. I'm thinking I'm gonna roll the car off the road and kill everyone in the car, but suddenly the tires catch again and I'm back on my way. I am able to calm down and take every one home, safe and sound (luckily) and I found out that a couple of the guys in the car were not wearing seatbelts. From now on when I'm not at 100% I use cruise control constantly. Better safe than sorry from now on. I'm just happy I survived that. Now to head to a more upbeat topic, THE RAP STYLINGS OF COOPLANDER!!!!!! I threw tees at him (ok now I was just having fun) Eventually I left, because I had to get back to work. I was closing that day so I didn't leave until around 10 o' clock that day. The parking lot is empty... except for two cars... my car and... the drunk guy's car. He was still there, passed out in his car. I drove away and he was gone the next day. Ok I am sorry that no one has posted in a while, basically I've been hanging out eating chicken fingers and getting drunk, but it is a two way street guys come on. A weekly feature, profiling one of the ladies of summer once per week. So without further adeiu, the woman we love this week is... Cameron Diaz Is this any great surprise? Sooo close!!! So god damn close!! I had my best round of golf today and I was this close (hands inches apart) from doing something amazing. I shot a 75 today!! That's 4 over par!! If it wasn't for a double bogey on the 2nd hole (the easiest on the course) I would have shot a 73, a score I can only hope to reach (for now). I had some problems in that round tho'. I pissed off some old ladies in front of my group because I hit into them. I tried to explain that I don't usually hit my 3 wood 300 yards but they were not listening. I felt shame. Anyways I actually birdied the hole that I felt shame on and I birdied the toughest hole on the course # 7. Also birdied #11. I'm surprised I didn't even birdie a par 5, crazy cooky. I went 37 38 for a 75!! I played again at 4:00 from the back tees and I almost did as well, I shot 79, but I shot 41 on the front nine, that means I shot 38 on the back, why can't I put two of those together? Front really sucked ass, but on the back I went: birdie, double bogey, par, birdie, bogey, par, par, bogey, par. On 15 and 16 I lipped out for birdies, but my putting was pure gold. This is just to let you boys out there know that there is a light at the end of the tunnel, a nearly perfect round can be had. By the way Geoff Mcleod did win his Canadian Junior Golf Association tournament in Cambridge at Whistlebear, with a 71 - 75 on a par 72 course. Good for him. I can't say that I'm the best of friends with fire hair (red hair joke), but I respect all the work and time he has put in to become a better golfer. Once again congrats to him for setting the bar for all us hacks. Horkins I'll see what I can do, but my opening for a party with no parental supervision is small. Only two weeks and during those two weeks I think that you are at camp, but I could throw you a little homecoming jam when you make your return. I'm sure the blog fans will be starving for Flounder posts. There may be a party while you are gone, but don't worry, you'll get your just desserts afterwards. Very comfortable right now because I just put in my air conditioner and I love it. With the weather like it is right now I need it, just don't think that I'm complaining, I love the weather. Peace out

I cannot wait to go to camp. 2 days gentlemen. "Can you quiet down lady? I can't hear myself slurp!" -Cal from UnderGrads (a grade A show, coopster)

Hello boys and gals!! Sorry for my absence over the last couple days, but I had a post written up on Thursday, and then my computer froze and I could not recover the material and as it was 2:00 AM I did not feel like rewriting it. I was dissapointed because it was a pretty good post. I might rewrite some of it at the end of the post. Anyways, with golf seemingly taking over the blog as the new cult subject (similar to the 6 line plays.) I'd like to put in my two cents on my current golfing situation. I golfed Saturday and for 11 holes I ripped up the course. I'll give you a short run down of my best drives. 1st hole - 255 yard 3 wood. 3rd hole - 290 yard driver. 4th hole - 290 yard 3 wood (its off a cliff). 6th hole - 283 yard driver. 7th hole - 260 yard driver. 9th hole - 230 yard 3 wood. 11th hole - 270 yard 3 wood. Now it starts to go downhill, 13th hole - 230 yard 3 wood. 16th hole - 230 yard driver. 17th hole - 240 yard 3 wood. Now these may mostly look like good drives, but every hole that I did not mention was a very dissapointing drive, not succesful, like sand traps, rough and the dreadful OTHER! Anyways I was 2 over after the first 9 holes, then it was a scramble with my mother, who is usually a very good golfer with a 17 handicap. Unfortunatley she was battling a swing change, a sore shoulder (past torn rotater cuff) and a sore wrist. This resulted in us placing mediocrely in the junior/senior tournament. Too bad because we have placed very well in this tournament in the past. Too bad. If I'd played well in the second half of the round I could have carried her on Saturday. Ah well. I tried to show in this paragraph to show how difficult it is to have a round where you play well for a full 18 holes. Just to join in the group frustration of everyone else with golf. Bateman, the pro golfer/hockey player was AK's character. You know, the one about the guy with the perfect life who kills himself. So you just insulted AK. For shame. AK is untouchable cool. It seems you have a problem with Ricci, since you're insult was aimed at Ricci not AK. Keep your venom to yourself J-Roc. You still cool tho'. Forcheesi!! Cool jam at my friend Lawson de Jamie's house. There was a supreme lack of chickitas, but there were many things to entertain us though (you know, things that Roy likes to have fun with :) We ended up running around St. Georges which is in his backyard. Jokes boys. Place was like two minutes from my house so I didn't even need to hook up a cabbie for me and my homies. OK. I said I would do and I will. This is the best part of my erased post on thursday. Here we go. Taken straight from Thursday's post. Yeah we had this tournament at Royal Woodbine today (Wednesday), and it was a lot of the sports media in Toronto. People like Hazel Mae, Jim Van Horne, Jim Hunt (the Fan 590), Greg Sansone and a bunch of little jockeys from Woodbine Racetrack. The funniest thing all day though was my interaction with Steve Kouleas (I don't care how his name is spelt), anyways, he pulls up in his BMW and I come up to his window to find out who he is and to get his clubs to get them on a cart. I come up to his window and say "Hi sir! How are you doing today?" "Great" "Can I get your name sir?" "You don't know who I am?" (Look of confusion from me) "I work for the Score?" (Still don't know who he is) "I'm Steve Kouleais, sports anchor for the Score. I can't believe you don 't know my name!" I'm just sitting there with my mouth hanging open wondering what the fuck (sorry) was wrong with this guy. I say fine and I take his clubs and I hope I never see him again. He was probably the most egotistical guy I have ever met. At least Jim Van Horne made up for Not Kooleaius. Van Horne was totally Van Damn Good!! That's it. I'd like to give a shout out to our fellow student at UCC Geoff Mcleod. On Saturday he was leading the CJGA event at Whistlebear after shooting a one under 71, hope he wins. So early congrats to the Mcleodinator. So hot right now (in a totally pletonic way) I think I may throw a party in the next month for all of the Flounder peoples. A cool pool party with lots of Roy's favourite tings, (we'll send a helicopter to pick him up from camp) I'll keep y'all posted on the p to the arty. Time to sleep now. I have to be up at about 7:30 today to work out to get some abs, play some golf and then tan so I don't get the dreaded golfers tan (you know where you're arms and head are red and the rest of your body is pasty white, nasty ugly) Its just like "earth to ugly tan guy." And then he's all like "earth to me guy I need to tan." "Earth to guy, yeah you do." "Earth to me, ok" "Hey guy do I look more naked like this? Or like this guy?" Cal - Undergrads I had to bring the quote back from the dead since I had yet to include an Undergrads quote. For Shame Cooplander. For Shame. Catch y'all on the flip side. FORCHEEESSSSIIIII!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
