Bishy, that sounds awesome... the counselorness not the being almost naked with two teachers... I just played like the worst round of golf ever in my life. Let me just say that it was three digits, and one was a 1 and one was a 7 and I won't tell you the middle one but it's probably higher than you think. Ouch. Why does God choose to let me shoot like some great rounds all week, when no one is watching (including a Chorkins record breaking 100) and then when the tournament comes around he smites me with this crap. I just hope I play better tommorrow. Yo, I just got a crazy feedback that I feel the need to answer RIGHT noW! anonymous terminator lover writes: "FOL I have a question that perhaps you could answer. How come I have to see all the movies my girlfriend wants to see (Finding nemo, dumb and dumberer, Charlie's Angels 2, Identity, etc) but when I tell her I want to see Terminator 3, she tells me to go with my brother?? Whenever we are watching the tv and the preview comes on, I burst out laughing at Arnold's line: "The t-x has corrupted my system!" and SHE says it kills the mood! what is going on here? do chicks not dig arnold movies as much as guys or something?" I'll tell you what's going on here. You are unable to pick a good date movie. In fact I would go as far as to say you don't deserve to see movies with chicks, but I'm nice so I won't. I'll just say that you need to get in touch with your feminine side and read this list: The Top Ten Reasons "Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines" is not a good date movie 10. There is no romance 9. It's full of violence, special effects, and large austrians 8. you will spend the whole time ogling the chick terminator 7. it severely lacks any presence of Leonardo Dicaprio 6. Honestly, what are your chances of making out during this movie? 5. The number "3" in a title, usually means it isn't a good date movie 4. Ask Will Dick what happened when he took a chick to see DareDevil 3. just what are you getting in the mood for while watching terminator previews anyways...? 2. There are more explosions than love scenes 1. It's just not a chick flick dude... There you go. My advice? See T3 with your bro, or better yet with the boys (I'm assuming you have a "posse" of boys to see it with). If you want a good date movie try showing off your intellectual side and see a more intelligent movie... like The Shape of Things maybe...

Wooooooooooord. Yo flounderland. What's poppin? I am so sorry I haven't posted lately guys. I have been super busy and super drunk and super tired all at the same time. I have been working at UCC baseball camp for a week now. The characters that come to such a camp amaze me. Oh and by the way, I was in a towel (just a towel) with Dr. G and JDT$ at my health club the other day. And with the recent scandals at UCC, someone else should finish this sentence for me. UCC Baseball Camp Counselor - Week One Ok gees, well I was happy to see that all of the staff was super cool at my camp. The two directors for the time being are supercool hotrod baseball players. Both on scholarships to Canadian and US universities respectively. The one dude that makes it so easy to wake up at 7 something every morinng is this fellow, Elliot or "El-Dawg" as he is known to most. John Spence will vouch for me that he fully could be a ghetto ninja. He is a piiiiiiiiiiiimp. haha el-dawg is a jokester who says some of the most lude, disrespectful things that I have ever heard. I witnised John and an unnamed varsity hockey player "put some greenery in the air" as the el-dawg would say. He also says stuff like "fa real," "woooord," and "holla." I love it. OK these kids that come to this camp are nuts and freaky. I have this one really cute kid who is all over me and the other counselors, the only problem is that he has 20+ warts on each hand. This is super gross. On wednesday, one of his warts started bleeding and I had to bandage him up while my co-counselors laughed and made barfing gestures and noises. There's also this other kid that leaves ninety percent of the food he eats on his face. The kid's also like 12 or 13 too. He is retarded. Other than that, the others pale in comparison. Except for this fat annoying kid who always taunts me, thus I nailed him in the nunchucks during dodgeball. Well guys, that's all I got. I've been staying up late at night, then waking up early for work and then napping after work. Buring th candle at both ends, as my dad calls it, is catching up with me. Well fuck that cuz I wanna go out. PS. Bateman is a grand lifeguard. Except when he doesn't show and I have 10 half naked kids running wild in the basement. Friggin get ur act together. Peace.

Horkins, Although I sent you the application to be blog administrator, I'm afarid I must retract my interest in obtaining that position. Their are several reasons why I have made this sudden, and seemingly random about-face. For one, although I have been an avid reader of Flounder Online ever since it's launch in May 2002, I did not begin posting until recently (about two weeks ago). Secondly, although I have access to the internet at my cottage, the laptop computer that I use is often taken back to the city for work purposes, making my administrative powers effective only when the computer is available (most likely to be on a weekly basis). Although I will continue to post from my locale on the Lake of Bays, it will be on a reduced schedule, (I apologise to all 2 of my fans) and if I was blog administrator, it would be impossible to keep up with the blog on a daily basis. Although I am Horkypoo's best buddy, and I could blind him with the sun's reflection from my Hermes or Gucci belt if he didn't choose me, the fact of the matter is that I lack senority and a computer - no way in hell do I deserve this job. Who the fcuk am I kidding. Regarding who should should get the job, it should, without question, go to Ian J. Bateman. Not only is J-ROC a good buddy of Horkypoo, but he has been posting the longest (sorry Spence, Bishy, Hudson et al). Cooper should, however, deserve serious consideration for the position with his extensive resume, including his skills at being a Goalie Coach and for beating up Michael Stephens. Seriously, Stephens gave Bateman a concussion and Cooper beat up Stephens - this deserves serious thought Horkins. As for the rest of the crew, none of them have submitted applications so it is difficult to say who should get the job, but if other people express an interest watch out Bateman and Cooper. By the way Hork-Dog, I played at Rosedle today in preperation for my match with Ian Wildgoose Brown, his dad and his grandfather tomorrow. As you are well aware, I have been struggling with my game for quite a long time - not anymore. I carded a solid 88 and no longer suck at golf, although "suck" is a relitive term. This could be my last post for a little while, as my post's are dependent on the arrival of a laptop at my cottage. So don't worry. I am not sick, dead, or stuck in Milan with a massive credit card debt. See y'all in 3 months. Cowie

And the editorial powers that be have swept throught he last two post and changed some names to protect those who are not so innocent... Sorry guys, it is a public website. Well, thespians and the like. Yesterday was our end of year theatre jam. Non-theatre students Willy and Walshy showed up. They were welcomed with open arms. [Roy] and [Frank] hacked like never before. This dissapointed me. The fact that [Roy] got a little sauced-up was no big deal though Cowie. Everyone needs to learn where their limits lay sometimes. [Roy] had a great time, needless to say. He didn't harm you, Matt. If you don't like seeing him like that, that's completely understandable but young people like us need to experiment and see what's doin. Just as long as he didn't go too far (which is really hard to do with some beer and a little smokaging). We all had a great time and Cowie, you really need to let loose buddy. Let the good times roll. So after our little diggity shin, a lovely man, Peter Irwin, helped me clean up. Man I though theatre guys were classy. You dudes messed up my house h-core. Who dropped the bottles? No worries though. It only took a little bit of cleaning. After this, we went to a couple of fine establishments, ingested some food and drinkstuffs. I then walked home. Begging cabbies to drive me home for free didn't work. After attempting this many times, they all shut me down and then I walked home very late at night, through a scary park in the rain. Adventurous night to say the least. Rumours have been floating around about spence's night. I missed him at these aforementioned establishments. I heard that it was a good HIGHer level theatre exam for him indeed. Horkypoo rocks on. Where is katie? I'm ansty to hear about the poon shivers. Nice seeing everyone yesterday. And, as Bateman's mom often gasps to me in ecstasy, "Let's do it again." --bishy

First off, many thanks are due to Bishy for hoasting a truly glorious jam yesterday. "You're level of [awesomeness] [was] shocking." Still, some credit should be given to [Roy], because even though he was servely under the influence, he was still walking (and [expelling the excess of his afternoon]) down Yonge Street. I FIXED IT! haha.... I truly am the greatest guy. Before I begin with the final exam update, I'm gonna say a few words about yesterday: Bish, it was a good time at your place thanks buddy, but afterwards let's just say it wasn't my proudest moments so let's not talk about it. Booth, I can't believe I was in that car with you... those poor Quizno's janitors. But enough of that... UCC Exam Marathon Update 2003: Final Edition Theatre : We did some sleuthing before the exam and found out that it was a play about a play in a play. It was Sam Beckett's Catastrophe and basically we had to put on paper, how we would put on this play. This exam went pretty well, I can't really say I had difficulties in writing how I do it. I was a little concerned when Cow-Dog wrote 4 books and I only 1 and a half. But really, the thing with this exam was that it wasn't really a review of the year. I could have probably more or less written the same exam before the year had started. And because of that I can't really say I am very confident of the result, but it was still pretty good. Chillness Factor : 3.75 klons out of 5

J-ROC, It is unbeleiveable that we forgot about Switzer. How could we? God that was stupid of us. What were we on? Oh yeah, I remember. Coffee. Maybe a republishing of the "Tool of the Year" list is in order. I enjoyed your classification of said individual; ("He is like the Craftsman Bolt-Out of the tool world") however, I beleive Switzer best fits the Fisher-Price plastic saw, or Atlanta Braves Novelty Hammer classification in terms of his tooliness. In addition Baty-man, you discuss the virtues of the show fastlane and others. Even J.Sp discusses the prowess of Train 48. I for the most part disagree with J-ROC's taste in television (Miami Vice, Hunter, Rockford Files, A-Team, et al), but I have watched Train 48 and found it to be somewhat humorous, these posts (for some reason) bring to mind Canadian television shows I once watched, namely Traders and Power Play. Ahh Traders. Who could forget the omonous opening sequence, with the sun rising and setting over the financial district of Toronto to the tune of nun's singing, and random bursts of techno music. From it's wobbly camera angles to the compelling acting, (namely Patrick McKenna of Red Green show fame as Marty, the crazy floor trader) Traders was a great show. And of course, one cannot forget Power Play. The intreguing drama of the Hamelton Steelheads Hockey Club, who were always strapped for cash, but still managed to defeat the Toronto Maple Leafs to win the Stanley Cup. It's theme song, a hard rock version of "The Good Old Hockey Game" may have even satisfied J-ROC's picky musical tastes. Honestly, this show was great. With Rod Black doing hockey commontary, Parker the hockey agent getting into all sorts of carzy mishaps, and Don Cherry coaching the Philidelphia Flyers, who couldn't love this show? By the way, open the College Times and read Pudelsky's leaving class resume. 250 words of things like "ska-rilla fa-rilla" and "flip the script." Spence would (and proably will when he sees it) shead a tear at this blatent butchering of the English language.

Well another season is over and tis the time we regretfully say goodbye to Sunnyvale Trailer Park for another year, but luckily 'studying' for exams has brought another great TV show back to my attention. Fastlane ! Possibly one of the greatest shows ever made/created (next to trailer park boys and clone high). It is a combination of VIP, Miami Viiiiiiiice, Baywatch, the Rockford Files, and Hunter. And it has to meet their quota of some kind of controversial scene every episode, my favourite was the lesbian kiss between Jamie Pressely and Tiffany Amber Theissen, as I am sure many of you will agree. Not only that but the boring plot is jam packed with car chases, shootouts, and scanditly clad women. Yes it is truly the marvel of modern day television. Now Hugh during that little play called KR2 kept bashing Chloe calling her this that and the next thing. But then what does he do? He decides that he'll supress his homo-sexual urges by going out with her (although i think that that is encouraging them, sorry Will). So now Chloe was going to the Batt with Hugh and Hugh to the formal with Chloe. But when I proposed the question to Hugh if had engaged in ye olde Josh Farr anal dry humpty dump with her yet, he told me to Fuck off. Sorry Hugh but the public has a right to know. By the way, your children will have hooves. Have fun kids, ya fucking tools.

OK J-ROC let's get one thing straight...I am not a Devils fan by any streach of imagination...Just an accurate hockey game predictor. The trap lulls me to sleep, and Ken Danyko is honestly the slowest skater I have ever seen in professional hockey. Granted, their are some people on the team who I like (Neidermayer, Broadeur) and I was happy that Pat Burns won a Cup (Why didn't you do it for the T-Dot in 1993) but I hate most of them (Stevens, Lamerello, et al). Honestly, Lou is such a tool, and should have been on J-ROC's list. Oh, and by the way J-ROC, we forgot a guy on the list, and I can beleive that we did so... Hugh Switzer Honestly, the whole Chloe situation deserved top three. First he bashes her, then he goes out with her??? What a tool! Anyway, back to hockey. Although you're proably right about the attendence figure - no one goes to those games - I not so sure about the pre-third pep talk. Maybe Babcock threw a giant cardbord cutout of himself in a fire bin, or Hans told him he "just got out of the shower," or maybe the team was so dissapointed following their trip to Compton where, to their chagrin, their is no street-hockey gang that they lost (no knucklepuck to elude Broadeur). On a more serious note, after walking accross the Quad yerterday morning on my way to my history exam, I noticed, emerging from Seaton's House, Brooker Belcourt. I walked over, hoping that UCC two most beautiful men could have a chat, but it turned out this wasn't Brooker, but instead a kid that just looked like him. Sure, this guy had the physique and the wavy locks...but he was ugly. Upon entering the school I was fortunate enough to run into the real Brooker. Here is an exermpt from the conversation... Cowie: Hey Brooker, I just saw an ugly version of you. Brooker: Who? John Spence? I quickly disagreed. Spence is not only a beautiful man, but also one of FOL's best writers. I informed Brooker that his ugly version was not Spence, but instead a border. Other FOL members please comment on this ugly version of Brooker (if you have seen him).

eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee - I am so happy - only one exam left and it's theatre. Hopefully I can improve on my 94% December exam. (Suck it Cowie, Horkins, Bishop, Bateman, Cooper, et al.) Okay I gotta get something out of the way: Sex in the City. Our beloved cooplander has been taking a lot of heat lately due to his affection for the program. I admit; I own the first three seasons on DVD (my mom and sis bought em) and I've probably watched a total of 3 or 4 episodes. By any objective standard of measurement, Sex in the City is a cleverly written, well-acted and ultimately above-average television series. Admittedly, it may be a tad pretentious for some, and others may feel their masculinity threatened by watching the show, however, this auhor has enough security in his sexuality to admit to watching and enjoying Sex in the City. For one, these chicks are big sluts who basically talk about sex nonstop. - that's pretty cool. Second, there is a lot of nudity, especially coutesy of that sexpot Samantha. Third, there is this one episode where Carrie dates this stoner. They sit around and get high and eat fried chicken and in the end the guy turns out to be a scrub so Carrie takes his weed and her and all her slutty friends get stoned and eat fried chicken together. Yeah, so I really enjoyed that one. So guys, lay off Cooplander, have an open mind, and have Sex. You won't regret it. Oh and also I got to give huge whattups to new Flounder members Katie Stoneman and Matthew "Diva" Cowie. I sense the sexiness factor just went up a few notches around here. Anyways, I'm really anxious to find out more about these poon shivers and I think the world is also ready for more information on Brooker's hideous body rash. Anyways, it's on in like eight minutes so I should wrap this up with a patented Cooplander quote: "All I want is a girl to dry-hump, leave, then brag to my friends about." -Gandhi

UCC Exam Marathon Update- Penultimate Edition English - This year we were treated to the privelege of having an oral (and rectal) english exam. Basically you get a poem or a passage, 20 mins to prepare notes, and then 15 minutes between you, a tape recorder, and your english teacher (WT!) So anyways I was lucky enough to draw a poem I had studied (The Tuft of Flowers) and I was able to get down some notes, and tried to organise it as best I could on the actual page they gave to us. Unfortunately, this commentary is no easy task. I'm not quite the impromptu speaker as Antony Dobrzenzky, so my impromptu commentary was riddled with "uh..." pauses, words I'm pretty sure don't exist (bewilderment?) and drawing blanks. I finished, in my opinion, WAY too early ("well we still have a lot of time left...") and WT basically took over and brought all sorts of crap I had never even thought of. The man is a genius and all I could do was be like "yeah" and just be like "it's definitely a metaphor... uh..." In the end he said it was short but concise, and overall, i think I remember he said it was "good" or maybe he said "very good" but I sure didn't feel good about it. A very different and tough exam. Chillness Factor : 2 klons out of 5 Coming up on Exam Update: Theatre, can you really study? Is that an excuse not to study? Don't you think Mr. Dick Hood's name is synonymous with foreskins? Will I crash and burn like at Xmas? Did you know that Harvey Fierstein was actually a dude before you saw his picture in the paper today? One word about the... er... contest. When you get a big package at camp they make you open it in front of the office lady to make sure there ain't no candy in it... so keep that and the fact that this month is one big job interview for me in mind... I want kool stuff not embarassing stuff. And klondikes will melt... 1 left and I'm free boys!

Wow! The Flounder is expanding by the day! Careful Chris we still want to have some sort of fan base or whatever it is we call people who read our blog. Even if someone watches "Queer As Folk" (I don't, I don't intend too, and if anyone says anything about me mentioning that show I'm just gonna...) Hey, this is weird, I'm listening to the soprano's theme song right... right... "Got yourself a gun" by like Alabama or something and then the next song that iTunes (great program btw... go macs!) randomly picks out of like 1000 other songs is "Got Yourself a Gun" by Nas... where he samples the previous song... WEIRD! Anyways... this is another "awards list" thang that me and Matt "Cletis T. Fullernoy" Cowie come up with every year and he suggested I post it this year so here it is. It's basically an award show we came up with for UCC/BSS theatre. So we can give ourselves awards... great isn't it? The Second Annual UCC Thespian's Guild Awards: The Tony Awards! copyright 2003 C. Horkins and M. Cowie Best Play Working (italics denotes winner) King Richard II Young Company This is one that Matt (our Senior Show dude) conceded to me. We both agreed that the most energetic, hap'nin', git up and dance, show of the year deserved this year's Best Play award. Best Actor Matthew Cowie - Bolingbroke in KR2 Rich Ly- Roberto in Working Will Dick- Duke of York in KR2 Zach Sniderman- King in Henry X part 7 Dan Bernhard- Mike in Working Was there ever any contest? Matt's performance as Bolingbroke blew any other leading actor's Mamet handbook out of their sorry hands. We even added Will and Rich to give this category some more credibility... honestly! MC-sqaured takes it. Best Actress Julia Cameron - King in KR2 Carleton Eckhart- Pam in Working Mercedes Grundy- Queen in KR2 Again, yeah there was really no question as to who should win here. With the whole chick playin' a dude thang pulled off with ease and just the general amazingness of her performance, Julia Cameron takes it (two years in a row btw...). Best Supporting Actor Curtis Westman - Aumerle in KR2 Ben Lewis- Conrad in Working Dan Goldbloom- Joe in Working Antony Dobrzenzsky- Gaunt in KR2 George Lace- Charlie in Working Chris Horkins- Rex in Working (there you go Matt, i totally do not deserve to be up here but you wanted it...) With so many great performances by actors (so many we just HAD to nominate them all!) in supporting roles this was a tough decision. However, the great Curtis Westman, practically a Little Theatre legend these days, proved that with experience comes a really freakin' awesome performance. While some claim he was shafted this year, Curtis stepped into his role as the dark, rebellious Aumerle with an almost natural ease. As WT would say: "Good on yer" Best Supporting Actress Kate Whitelaw - Green/Fitzwater in KR2 Maya Janikowski- Roberta in Working Megan Loach- Grace in Working We both agreed that Kate's performance was the best of any actress in a supporting role. The chick playin a dude factor was in effect as was the offstage death factor, the glove throwing factor, and the yellow glasses factor. A truly great performance. Best Set Design Working King Richard II Young Company Seeing as the KR2 set consisted of a throne, and a coffin, and the Young Co. was basically some furniture, and some painted screens made by Dave Steinbach (they were awesome Dave!), we decided that Working's awesome scaffolding deserved the set design award. Way to go James Weeke's and his physics class! Best Breakthrough Performance Jon Polubiec -Northumberland in KR2 Zach Sniderman- King in Henry X part 7 Dan Cheddie- Anthony in Working Clifford Chiu- Al in Working Our annual award for the best performance by an actor new to the Little Theatre scene (for all intensive purposes this means first Upper School Play) was a surprisingly older award this year with several new seniors breaking onto the David Chu stage. However in the end it would have to be cleanliness advocate Jon Polubiec's performance as the badass Northumberland in KR2 that would take it. Best Onstage Team The Office Scene - Working Bolingbroke and Northumberland - KR2 Ross and Willoughby- KR2 Ralph Werner and Charlie Blossom- Working The funnest award this year (borrowed straight from the MTV awards) ended up in a tie! That's what you get when only two people vote on this... Matt's vote was for (surprise!) himself and his and Jon Polubiec's performance (of dubious teamliness). And my vote was for (surprise surprise!!) myself and the other 5 actors and actresses making up the hilarious, serious, office/cubicle scene from Working. That's all of 'em. But wait, there is one or two more awards... the Award for "Hottest Chick" which was J-Roc's idea so I'll let him handle it if he wants to elaborate on who he decided deserved this year's honours. And as for the... worst actor award... i don't want to put any more hate up on this blog so I won't elaborate best, cheddie Till next time take it easy...

In response to Horkins' maintainence of "Terrorism is real": Terrorism is as real as Communism. As real as the drug problem is now. The War on Terror is as arbitrary, superficial and manipulative as the "war on communism" and the "war on drugs" First, Communism: After the second world war and before the collapse of the U.S.S.R. in 1989, the United States was at war with communism. The read scares of the 1920s and 1950s are oddly similar to the terror scares of the 2000s. The United States would assist knowingly corrupt and abusive regimes as long as they weren't communist. In fact, starting in 1979, the United States supported and trained Osama bin Laden and his Taleban regime in order to fight off those scary Soviets. Funny how things change. Second, drugs: Prior to 1937, smoking weed was legal in the states. From 1919 thru to about 1929, drinking beer was not. Despite the clear failure of both prohibitive initiatives, the government persists in their war on drugs. More people have been incarcerated for drug charges in the United States that in every other country in the world COMBINED. As Dennis Miller once said, "You can take away the drugs, but people will still spin around 'till they fall down and see God." Terrorism is about as dangerous as pre-1989 Russia and as combatable as the kids smoking weed on frybrook. Honestly, U.S. policy is so fucked up I can't contain my frustration.

Spence, welcome back! And thank you for that example of free speech. I'd like to clear one thing up. Gwynn Dyer did not "burn" me when he spoke in assembly. If anything he made himself look stupid. I asked how he could call terrorism not really a threat after semptember 11th when 3000 people died in a terrorist attack, and the people responsible are still alive, and he proceeded to trivialise the deaths of those Americans who died that day. Dr. Dyer was inconsiderate to say that 3000 people wasn't a lot of people and that it didn't constitute a "threat". What if one member of his family was murdered and he knew the killer was on the loose, Would that be a threat? Terrorism is real. September 11th is more than enough of a scary precedent to justify removing threats to the safety of America. The War on Iraq was not some kind of first step towards a "Pax Americana", nor was it a war for oil, nor was it a war to "liberate Iraq", it was a war to remove the anti american threat (which did exist) in Iraq. I think a lot of people have forgotten the kind of emotions we all felt on September 11th 2001. With help from some emotional memory I think we can all find some empathy for what the United States are going through right now. War is not the answer, but sometimes it's the only way out. But enough politics for now, I was out playing golf and who should be right behind me but Brooker "Smirnoff Ice" Belcourt. Not a good golf day for me... I can't believe I duffed my drive on the first hole in front of UCC's most beautifullest man. So ashamed right now. Bateman, did you listen any of the 50 million times that Tompkins told us the Silken Tent was a large metaphor comparing a woman to a tent, not about a tent spider, or an actual woman and her tent, or even phallic imagery (bish)... And Cooper, I can't believe your phone went off that is hilarious "Who the f-ck is calling me?" LOL. The IB headquarters in Geneva must keep that shit for a rainy day... jokes... my review of the oral and rectal exam coming up sometime after 11:30 on monday. Cooper I can't believe you thought our IB2s picture was good. It was like the worst one, except maybe for Brem... they had the backup "generic photo" after their pimps picture was turned down. Personally I give it to my homey Alex Richardson and Mowbray's for their basketball team photo... the black and whiteness was so key. Well anyways thats enough for now... PEACE

Heeeeeeeere's Johnny! That's right, I'm back. After a brief, albiet tough, sabattical due to "conduct probation", I have returned to save Flounder Online from succumbing to the horrors of mediocrity. Now that I'm off conduct probation (I think -- Hood has yet to contact Lowndes to vouch for my character, which we all know to be stellar and a fine example of a UCC boy), I feel it is time to return to the joy of posting. This post is actually focused on an element from the recent"tool" list by Cooper and a comment by h-kins. Ignoring horkypoo's and Cooplander's DUBIOUS (to say the least) taste in music, a couple comments struck me as ignorant, musically and culturally retarded and completey oblivious to what's happening on our little planet. Cooper called Matt Good a tool because "You're [sic] ego made your band break up, you're [sic] new album is ok, but you're still a tool." Fair enough. Matthew Good does have a huge ego (he did name his band after himself), but he does write, sing and compose all the songs. Honestly, there are a million people out there who can drum and play the guitar, but talented singer/songwriters are few and far between. However, it was Horkins' comment that really disturbed me: "Matt Good is stupid because he can't make a song/video without being so repulsively, blandly, fakely [sic], repetitively anit-america/establishment/the man/everyone who isn't me. Get a life man... I did buy MGB's last album though, it was alright [sic]. And also he is quoted so frequently by Nowers... what is up with that? Matthew aka Matt Good, you are a tool." This makes me wonder has Horkypoo actually listened to any Matt Good song or watched any video besides "In a World called Catastophe"? Furthermore, does he actually know what the fuck he's talking about when he says "anti-america/establishment/the man"? As we ALL know, western democracy is the best way of life. (Sense the sarcasm, boys.) I'm sure horkins can sit in his forest hill home typing on his $2 000 computer and bitch about anti-establishmentarianism while "the establishment" caters to his every whim. Matthew Good is an intelligent man, aware of what's going on, who happens to make kick-ass music about it. Let's face the facts, dudes. The United States of America has declared war on "terrorism" In a speech by President Bush after 9-11, he issued the ultimatum, "You are either with us, or the terrorists". There are no terrorists. There is no global Al Qaeda conspiracy to dismantle the United States. The U.S. was not, is not and never will be threatened by any global terrorist network. Less than 3 000 people died on September 11. Since the War - and we must call it war - began, tens of thousands have been killed, injured or displaced as a result of the U.S. led War on Terror. I can only wonder how many more will die before we are "safe" from terror. In March 2003, the United States invaded Iraq under the pretext of Iraq's posession of Weapons of Mass Destruction and ties to Al Qaeda. Since then, an occupying force of over 140 000 personnel has yet to discover said weapons or links to terror. Furthermore, threatening rhetoric has begun towards Iran, Syria and North Korea - rogue states, threats to democracy, enemies of the United States people. A war with any of these countries will surely see more than 150 U.S. servicemen come home in bodybags and WAY more than the 6 000-odd civillians who died in the last war. How many have to die before the U.S. people realize they are on a path to destruction. We live in a time where aggressive and imperialistic foriegn policy is bolstered by CNN's sanitized and sensational warefare. In a few years there will be no survivors of the bloody battles of WWII, Korea and Viet Nam. Soon, the only wars we will know will be the Gulf, Afghanistan and Iraq - the sanitized nightvision shots of bombs exploding over Bagdhad and Kabul. Stories of the "rescue" of Jessica Lynch. The "liberation" of Baghdad. Suddenly, the absurd sensationalism of the yellow press during the Spanish - American War doesn't seem so archaic (see i have been studying.) The world is still unsure as to what exactly the United States hopes to achieve with their unilateral pseudo-imperialistic and increasingly war-like foreign policy, but you can bet your Simple Plan concert tickets that if this sort of shit continues, we are all gonna be a hell of a lot worse off. Horkins - You and I may be at opposite ends of the political spectrum, but you can't ignore the facts. Rome was the original democracy - the first nation-state that spawned an empire. The senate felt everyone should be so lucky as to fall under the grace of Rome, the benevolent, the democratic, the invincible. Look what happened there. You know how they say history repeats itself? There is some truth to that... Matt Good, despite his egomaniacal flaws, is a keen social commentator and an advocate of human rights. To be anti-american does not mean one is anti-democratic or free speech or any of those luxuries we have come to feel we deserve along with our morning paper. Anti-americanism can simple be the opposition to U.S. global dominance, which is growing and will continue to grow unless we get off our Lay-z-Boy and do something about it. As we enter the 21st century, distracted by our menagerie of shiny objects and CNN's "War in ____", I pray we don't succumb to the Pax-Americana that threatens to supersize, homogenize, and ultimately destroy the earth as we know it. "Fake lightning flashes over the skyline. A deer in your headlights. So gun it, gun it, gun it, gun it. We're singing songs about 21st century living. There's hate in your heart, man. You'll take what you're given." "21st Century Living" - Matt Good - Avalanche. If you can't discern what he's talking about, they probably have a place for you on the Bush foreign policy committe. Peace. ( I Hope.)

Two matters of business: UCC Exam Marathon Update #3 Systems : I knew this would be the hardest one yet. And it was. While most people, like Matt "he's not exactly doing mamet here" Cowie, will tell you it was easy, I disagree... disagree old skool! This exam was tough. I kept finishing the papers early and being like, wow, maybe I should have written more, not guessed so much, and studied a lot more. Although it would be freakin impossible to cover all the material on this exam. Paper 2 was based on a lab that's due next year! I haven't started it yet! How am I supposed to know that shit! There's always one that spoils your roll... and to clarify Dr. Hamr is still the man (he's invincible, he could give me a 1 and be the man...) Chillness Factor : 1/2 of a klon out of 5 (practically warm...) order number two: I just saw the new Jim Carrey movie "Bruce Almighty" which received mixed reviews from Eric "Esticlaaaaaade" Estey, and Matt "Number 2 with 5 stylish new suits for $50" Cowie, ranging from "it was pretty bad" to "it was alright". I tended to air on the more praising side, it's a Jim Carrey movie how bad could it be, but really Jim Carrey makes this movie, with any other actor it would have absolutely sucked. Although that Jennifer Aniston (so hot right now...). Anyways, some good laughs, it's not a classic like "Dumb and Dumber" or "The Mask" or, or, "Ace Ventura 2: When Nature Calls"... but its still Jim Carrey back doing what he does best.... okay three orders of business: We saw Brooker "Squash is not just a tasty vegetable" Belcourt and his girlfriend, the blog's number 1 fan, Katie who had just seen the Matrix. A pleasure to finally meet someone who enjoys what we post here so much. Big Shoutouts, guys. okay... actually there's four orders of business: This is a good one, it's another list but a coool list. I present you with the 180 Awards! The 180 Awards is given to the top 5 people (uh... at UCC) who have made a 180 degree turn in their personality this year. So without any further adue the 180 Awards... 1. Adam Cooper: just one look at the Howard's page of the yearbook makes you realise that the Adam Cooper pictured there is NOT the same person as the new, improved, more evenly tanned Cooplander we know today. From the copious amounts of gel in the hair, to the bronze godliness, as WT said "It's the birth of a new Cooper!" (i think it's a change for the better) 2. Will Dick: The same great guy and friend throughout the year but he really did change from the stylish suit wearing, bowler hat toting energetic theatre dude we knew in FY to this year's more mature, Frybrook frequenting, dark, seafoam and orange shirt sporting cool Will Dick we know now. As Antony Dobrzensky, who brought this to my attention, put it "You know at the beginning of the year he was all full of energy on the stage, and the other day I see him all crouched up between two cars on Frybrook (so no one could see him) taking a puff." What happened? Tobacco and Chloe Brown. Will, I love you man, but you pulled a 180 on us. 3. "Nino" Ricci: This guy was pretty cool in my books at the beginning of the year. Now he has been declared by Bateman as the "Tool of the Year". While I wouldn't exactly call him the most toolish person at UCC, I would say several toolish deeds have caused his steady rise into tool-hood. Like screwing up our scale for the Theatre project leaving us open to a barrage of insults from Spence. I hate to be a falcon here, but nescafe has really pulled a 180 nearing the end of this year. As J-ROC here said "Now I had suggested that he be the tool of the year, but it was deemed by the judges panel that he sheer toolness had only been at its peak for a maximum of two terms. But what a fucking tool!" 4. James Black: Well, he's pretty much the same guy. But he became a boarder. That's a 180 if you ask me. In the words of me "Black's a boarder?" 5. Me: Yeah that's right, me. I sure pulled a 180 on myself this year. First of all, I actually had a pretty big role in two different plays (wow thats a first). Then I actually joined a sports team, b-ball, albeit as a manager... which introduced me to rap music, which I began to write. Now I own a fake 50 cent bling. And speaking of NYC... that was a pretty different experience there... I think I've changed a lot this year, but still remained somewhat the same... in the words of Bateman "i dunno man honestly? i think that you have changed alot" so there you go... 180 awards feel free to comment.

Before today's exam update, I hafta get one thing out of the way. UCC Exam Marathon Update #2 Math Studies - Normally a studies exam wouldn't be so ominous and looming for me, but I hadn't really paid much attention this term and some bad test results led me to think this would be a very difficult exam.... boy was I wrong. Wow, was it just me? or was that a really easy exam? No, it was an easy exam. First of all, the questions were all easy and straightforward, they all told you what to do, and most of them how to do it (that formula booklet is like cheating... only it's not!) Basically if you could operate a TI-83 (or any of the TI family of calculators) and had a pulse, you pass this exam. Although once again, i may have completely misjudged this one... but if I did I am one stupid dipshit because that exam was freakin easy. Chillness Factor: 7 klons out of 5 Next time on Exam Update... Yeah, I am really shitting my pants over Systems, I can't believe I put it 4 on my pre exam list of hardness... it is gonna be really hard. I want to study but something tells me I'm gonna be designing the new FOL Gear (it's happening soon, get your credit cards ready). But yeah, Systems will be tough. All that environmental and systems... aaaah! I'm gonna be studying, unlike Matt "I never miss theatre, even when The View is on!" Cowie who is going to see this BSS drama night thing of Alice in Wonderland with SConnor's girlfriend as Alice or something... have fun Matt. We'll see how it goes tommorrow. Until then, I'm out. I suggest blueberry. here's a cooper-esque quote (from the tmnt site!): One can pay back a loan of gold, but one dies forever in debt to those who are kind. - Malayan Proverb - those Malayan's, always with their proverbs...

UCC Exam Marathon Update: French : The first exam, and easiest so far, for many, SL French turned out to be exactly what was expected and less. The same old same old reading comp stuff came up (some article about how snails like to eat paint...) and then there was a composition, where I wrote a letter to Jean-Paul Sartre. I must have been done like 4 hours early and it was a 2 hour exam. I spent half the time drawing pictures of Mr. Miller (that dick wouldn't let me have my water bottle because it wasn't clear "how do i know it's water?" you wanna see you old cock? what an ass...) Wow. If I failed this exam then I must be mentally retarded. Chillness Rating : 5 klons out of 5 (can you think of a better scale?) Geo : IB1 Geo students felt they could look forward to a challenging exam that could potentially cover more material than... uh... a really big blanket! And it did! This exam was tough. Chose 2 of 3 different big 25 mark questions on the following chapters: sustainable development/population, urbanisation, and malnourishment/agriculture. So basically the whole year was on this exam. Luckily you could pick and choose stuff you knew to some extent, unfortunately you needed a lot of MDC/LDC examples, I tried to incorporate as much as I knew. Is there a food shortage in Kenya? There better be... Mens better be impressed by my charts, maps and sketches. Overall this was a tough exam which required hand cramping amounts of writing crammed into a 1.5 hour period (barely enough time). I think I handled it pretty well though. Chillness Rating : 3 klons out of 5 (can you think of a better scale?) Next time on Exam Update: Math Studies: "Wow, I am the smartest kid and studies is truly for retards, whoa studies!!" or "I'm serious it's actually not that easy! Shut up Chris Li!" ??? and perhaps... Systems: "Dr. Hamr, you are the greatest teacher ever." or "maybe I should've paid attention all year in this class..." ??? And on a side note a big shout out to brooker's girlfriend and her friends that read the blog, it's become clear to me that this blog actually has "fans", groupies even, and she is apparently the no. 1 fan of the blog. So yeah, shout outs. Take it easy y'all.

Horkins it is good to have you back. I don't know of anyone who stimulates more discussion on the FOL than thou. Yes you would be right that I should never in my lifetime make any attempt at rapping, rhyming or dropping a beat. It was a failure of epic proportions. Anyways you were missed. Timing is everything. At least that's what I'm telling myself right now. While daydreaming at work today I thought that maybe since I have nothing to talk about on the blog that I should review a couple movies I saw over the summer. It couldn't be a worse idea than my rapping. So I log on to the blog read down and... ARGGGHHH!! Horkins ya beat me to the punch. I guess great minds think alike... or it was just a very odd coincedence, probably the latter since I am far from a great mind. Here is my contribution, notice that my grading system is slightly different from H-Kin's. The Hulk I came into this movie not expecting much, but I was pleasently surprised. The writers were able to adapt Stan Lee's classic comic to the silver screen amazingly. I admit I never read or saw anything Hulk related until this movie, but the plot actually made a lot of sense. I will not give you a total run down of the plot but let's say it filled in some holes that my friends explained for me from the comics. A few key things I'd like to mention: using frames to give the effect of an actual comic book was kinda cool, the relationships between the four major characters was very well thought out and original and my favourite part was the short walk by cameos by Stan Lee and the actor who played the Hulk in the live action series. The only drawback of the movie was the awful CGI. The Hulk looked like a poor man's Shrek. Very badly done. As well the fight scenes seemed to unrealistic, at one point Hulk caught a missle bit off the top and threw it back at a helicopter, right... As well Hulk seemed too invincible, it just makes any sequels set up for disaster. But overall I enjoyed this movie thoroughly so I give it... 3.75 hair gel bottles out of 5 28 Days Later Now this movie really struck a cord with me. Think The Stand meets Planet of the Apes. Man wakes up out of a coma 28 days after a disease is released into the world from apes. This disease turns humans into bloodthirsty, half animal, half human beasts, who want to kill all humans and the disease is highly contagious to the point where a scratch from these beasts can infect you. Within 15 seconds of infection the people transform. I know kinda out there. Anyways the movie takes a great look at human's will to survive. The crappy production quality actually helps with the plot of the movie because everything seems blear and dreary. The only negative I have for this movie is that the ending is a total cop out, tool ending. In conclusion, this movie is a must see for any fan of horror. 4.5 hair gel bottles out of 5 Anyone else realize how desperate for ideas Hollywood is? First you have Terminater 3 and next summer we will be getting The Punisher. Oh and American Wedding will probably blow ass. My favourite joke of the moment... How many people with ADD does it take to screw in a lightbulb? How many? Wanna go for a bike ride? Trust me its funny if someone is actually telling it to ya. Lates

I'm actually kinda disappointed that I'm being allowed to post only once a day yet still be the only guy posting three days in a row. Not cool folks, post it up. So I saw this "Pirates of Caribbean" business last night and I realised, I freakin love pirates. I know it's not quite in line with the urlLink ninja thang but hey, pirates are cool nonetheless. And this movie was seriously good despite how crappy it may have looked in the previews. Which is exactly the opposite of Terminator 3 (viewed in beautiful Haliburton's Molou theatre on night off), which is probably the biggest letdown of a film I have ever seen... you know what, I'm startin this all over again. H-kins' Summer Movie ROUND-UP! Matrix Reloaded Really awesome fight scenes, the plot was pretty intense and too hard for my non-geek brain to understand at times. Lots of gratuitous sex. 3.5 Pizzas out of 5 Bruce Almighty Definitely not a Jim Carrey Classic, but funny nonetheless. Interesting concept. A good romantic comedy if nothing else. not bad, but also not good. 2 Pizzas out of 5 The Italian Job Great Action sequences, sweet Mini chase (makes you want Luca's car... I'm serious). Charlize Theron is HOT. 5 Pizzas out of 5 T3: Rise of the Machines This is NOT a sequel to T2, this is a disgrace to the Terminator franchise. Great action is squeezed in at innopportune moments. The plot is weak and the ending is disappointing. 1 Pizza out of 5 Pirates of the Carribbean: Curse of the Black Pearl PIRATES! Swashbuckling action, an intense plot combining legend, adventure, and the open sea. The best movie based on a ride ever made. 5 Pizzas out of 5 Feel free to add to this if you've seen more than I have. And that's all I got.

And Ian "the world's greatest friend in the world" Bateman has got tickets. So weather just tone this rain stuff down by Wednesday okay? Cool.

I'm BAAAAAAAAAAAAACK! S'right... I just got off the bus back from the sunny shores of Camp Ponacka (aka Pornacka) where I thoroughly enjoyed fulfilling my role as one of 14 Counselours In Training (CITs), which is basically a nice word for the guys who pay money to come and do all the the bitch-work and maybe if they're really good we'll let them be counselours next year. But it really was a great time. Our cabin was packed with 14 of the coolest guys I've ever had the privelege to spend time with. Some old friends (one dude I'v been in the same cabin as for like 8 years) and some new ones (5 guys crossing over from August camp) including a prettyboy even prettier than Matthew Cowie himself (I know it's blasphemy but it's true). We worked our butts off and hopefully I'll have the privelege of teaching kids the fine arts of Pottery, Nature, and/or Lapidary (the art of turning rocks into semi-precious stones... uh... ask Steinbach) next year. So anyways... no one sent me shit so you all lose the contest. I got one letter and it was from my mom... so my mom wins. Cowie, you were supposed to get me chickmail... i was disappointed. And what has happened to this site lately? Honestly this is the Cooper and Bateman show... and after reading cooper's first post after I left I decided not to read his other ones, never rap again. Bateman you're good but on your own it's just not enough Bishy and Spence lit up the site briefly but there needs to be more variety really... Anyways I hope people still read this crap... Ian, how did you find out your teachers for next year? I hope I'm in your english class again with Wayne, that was good times. And on the subject of Report Cards, it seems I have slipped from 34 to 33 due to a move back to a 5 in Geo without the compensating move back up in Systems... overall my exam marks were really good, except for the 66 in systems (note to self: study next year). I was really surprised to see I got a 90 on my oral commentary, I thought I sucked it up big time... but Wayne is such a great guy he said I was ready for IB2 work... yeahyeah! And on a closing note our new principal's name is Dr. Power, but sadly his first name is not Max. Maaaax Power! The man with the name you would love to touch... but you must not tooooouch! -Homer Simpson

Well it looks like I know who two of my teachers are next year, it looks like I have Churchward for Theatre and Tompkins again for English, well WT if you're out there I promise to put my "disrespectful" ways behind me, like the song says " Why can't we be friends?" Got to Go now, I'm late "Its not a tumor!" -Arnold

OK guys Im sorry for not posting in a while, but my internet is down right now and I am currently using the computer in the WAC Office (I'm on Lunch). Anyway, work has been ok, better at times lately but that is about it. Last week I went to see an incredible movie, it was just so good words can't describe it. Charlies Angels Two: Full Throttle was the shit, I'm sorry but it was just so unbelievable good there was this one scene where Cameron Diaz is out on her surf board, it was money. The ending was weak and this motorcycle chase was really bad, and there were a couple of other really bad parts, but some parts were really good, McG (the director) also directs Fastlane, and lets just say that this movie was as good if not better than some episodes of Fastlane, yes it was that good, I just hope that they make a Charlies Angels 3. There is only one movie that will be able to top it, The Shape of Things Movie, coming soon to a theatre near you. Now since I am in the dirty WAC/OMP office I have come across an email sent by David Canella, it reads: Fellow Comrads, My name is David Canella and I am the associate chair of the 19th annual Ontario Model Parliment. You have been chosen to take part in prestigious roles in the executive committee if the simulation in 2004. You were selected because of your keen interest and valuable skills. If you have a genuine interest in politics, administration, similarly inclined colleagues of the opposite sexual persuation or just free food, like the Bapoo, then the OMP Exec is meant for you..... (it kind of keeps going on for a bit) Where the fuck do they come up with some of this shit? Honestly, what the fuck does "similarly inclined colleagues of the opposite sexual persuation" mean? I guess thats why Im not in OMP, man Canella know wonder you were one of the tools of the year. What a fucking tool.

Well Cooper see you in August man, I know you'll have some crazy stories to tell us. Anyway moving on, I got some feedback so I'll post it now. Anonymous............ I agree heartily with John's suggestion that Cooplander's reckless posting must stop permanently. John referred to posting as a 'right' "I only motion that Adam Cooper's posting rights be suspended indefinately," however posting on Flounder Online is not a right, it's a privilage, one that Cooplander has abused copiously as of late. As a loyal Flounder fan, and possibly one of the only remaining ones due to the plethora of crap that comes from Cooplander's computer, I would hope that Cooplander can be halted before his mindless drunken babble destroys what is left of Flounder's fan base. Well that was pretty harsh, but justified we don't post for the sake of posting, when we have something to say we say it. Even if it is a slow week and you know we're not doing anything we don't post. I mean no one wants to hear me saying I crossed the street like 5 times today. Yesterday, I went to see Bowling For Columbine with Will Dick, a former blogger. It was really good, if you haven't seen it, you should there are really funny parts but it makes you think. Highly recommend it, it was the best movie I've seen this year. Michael Moore is the epitamy of the shit disturber species. There was this bit with one of the guys who was a well known associate of Timothy McVeigh, and they were talking about weapons and Moore asked what the worst thing he had ever made was, the guy was making 5 gallon jugs of homemade napalm, for self defense I'm sure. Another bit was with this guy who had a hat saying "Fuck Everybody" in Michigan who said that it was possible for anybody to be an enemy, he also said that he stole guns and then went into Detroit and sold them to gangs there. Will has got his G2 and been driving and he drove us down to the movie, sketchy..... but fun cause Will is pretty jokes about the whole thing. Yeah I was holding on pretty hard throughout the whole thing. Farouk is far worse though, the guy just runs red lights cause he is in the wrong lane. "Do you wanna see how much I can take? Can't you just leave bad love alone?..." -Sunday's Best

Under intense criticism and now on "conduct probation" I feel it is finally time to take a break. Until JJ returns I will remain silent in the shadows. I realize that most of my posts in the last few weeks have been complete and utter shit, 'tis the effect of time away from school. I will take this time off to recharge, read a few books and try to recapture the gold that made me so beloved at the beginning of my time on the blog. Possibly repackeged with a new gimmick (cooplander is dead and gone.. for now) new formats, anything. I feel lost at this point, looking for success but it continues to elude me. With the return of two of our most beloved bloggers I will leave you in their hands. I trust that they will not dissapoint me. Goodbye

Cooper, it seems that the overwhelming majority feels that you should be suspended. I have thought it over and have decided that I cannot morally take you off the blog without forewarning. She has graced the everything from Saved by the Bell, to her Oscar caliber performance in The Ladies Man. Tiffany Amber Theissen I must say that she had some what fallen by the way side, but she came back in full force by landing a role in Fastlane. "Sometimes when I'm listening to music, I nod my head like this as if I'm saying 'Yes! Yes! Yes! To every beat.' And sometimes I shake my head like I'm saying 'No, No, No! Don't stop rocking!' "

Wow. I didn't think I had been away for that long but there is even a new format when you post, complete with cool blue swirly deals. I love it. I have had a brilliant week off of work; sleeping in, doing nothing and trying to go out at night. The only thing is that most people are tired from work and don't want to go out. Boring drones. Don't come back on here and say: "If you don't like it, don't read it." Except yours would be filled with hundreds of grammatical, punctuation and spelling errors. Bateman should re-post the adress on here so we can get on that. Even though I most likely won't. Spence- congrats on your official removal from conduct probation. Now you are free to frolic in your creative yet shit-disturbing land of half-chubia. Word up. --bish

Hellllllloooooooo NURSE! I'm sorry, I've been working at Mooredale Day Camp for the past week and it would seem appropriate to begin the post with an endearing quote from one of my beloved childhood shows, Animaniacs . Oh, Yakko, Wakko and Dot... Anyways, I haven't been checking Flounder regularly, let alone posting, and I must say, that the quality has deteriorated substantially. I am not going to detail the bscene amount of staggeringly stupid content that has manifested itself on this once affluent site. I only motion that Adam Cooper's posting rights be suspended indefinately. I would rather have a complete drought of posts than constant torrents of Cooper's 1 300-word idiocy. On to more pleasant matters, not an hour ago I recieved a signed letter from Colin Lowndes declaring my removal from conduct probation. Reportcardwise, I managed a 35 thanks to somehow winging a 72 on the French exam and hauling my mark up to a respectable 5-. Damn Hoody and his prissy theatre exam, I got an 89 but the 7 eluded me... Also, I'm laughing at all those mega-keeners who devote ungodly time and resources to the study and practive of HL History. I gotta tell ya, not once did I ever copy down that stupid Course Code, Date, Class # Bullshit, I think I may have done my homework once or twice, and only when I knew he would be checking, and only after I got bishy fishy to agree to do half. To top it all off, I decided it would be more beneficial to, rather than study, engage in youthful debauchery on the eve of my exam. And somehow, SOMEHOW, I snagged an 87 on the exam and a 6+ on the year. However, I hate all you HL English guys who are in any class but Dr. Churchward's and got a 7, but not as much as I rue the 3 non-English students who won English prizes. Remember me? I won the Ponton prize this one time.... But now I gotta take the doggy for a walk. Peace

I cannot say that I am sober, but I'm concious so that's a plusy, I should really learn how to rhymy. They be chasing me around with these guns and I be doing Tarzan on the trees (swinging around the trees to do a quick 180 and trip them up. I was trying to bend one about 5 minutes after it was finished and my wrist caught a hot part and my wrist got all burnt up, no pain just like discomfort, pain is for wussy babies, LOVE THE PAIN!!! jks. I wanted to smack them, becuase the cops are almost never on the highway and when they are they are looking for people going over 140, not the 120 people, fuck 'em. And they don't like POD either, waht the fucks up with them. At least my mom and sister are going to PEI for hockey for 2 weeks. Too bad my dad isn't going with them. At least I can party at home when my dad is at work during the day and when I'm not at work. Studies boys make a logic statement for that!!! JKS! Griff rules... maybe. Cool guy, but he expects us to work as hard as his gifted fucking higher math guys, why do you think we're in studies? We're lazy and not as gifted as the higher guys. If we went to studies then we were content with where we were in math, otherwise we would stay in methods and work our asses off. Has to be said. If 4 guys in a class of 16 or something do their homework you shouldn't get mad just accpet it. We're lazy. We might wake up about our schooling, but that may not happen till University. In case Griffen reads this: I do think you are one of the better teachers in the school and you deserve your position as head of math, but 5 minutes of homework is the same as 20 minutes, it still requires us to open our books. Don't worry Griff, much love goes out to you for your help this year, happy you're my teacher next year. Man that was a weird rant. By the way Jane's Addiction still rules. Just Because is f-ing amazing!! I think the disck comes out July 20th or something. Ruled in the early 90's and they still rule now, that vocalist is amazing. Sounds nostalgic and new at the same time... crazy. I'm picking up that disk, only other cd's I've bought over the last 2 years were both Linkin Park. This will be the first non LP in a few years, can't wait for faint. Time to hit the raps. I'll get through as many as I can. Should have done these while I was still drunk, now I'm just buzzed, well we'll see how it goes, probably still suck, well here it goes. starting with... hmm... who was in our class... hmm... "actually, im a random chick not a guy, and i'd tell you who i was, but i'd get killed. but i can assure you, bateman and kristen got it on... do i need to provide a play by play? you know you love me, gossipgirl" Well gossipgirl, seeing as you won't reveal your true identity to me and the world I really don't know if I "love you" or not. Regardless of whether it's true or not I'm sure he doesn't appreciate it that you're abusing the anonymity of the FOL feedback system to tell the world of his supposed exploits (I'm publishing you out of sheer courtesy for the small yet intense fanbase this site enjoys). It's made more boring cause I don't really know anyone there, well I do sort of know some people (Hudson's girlfriend is in the same class as Luca would say "girlfriend of Pedro, and some random IB1's that I don't know that well). Okay this feedback from my good friend with a phallic themed name sums up my feelings exactly: "What the fuck! Your site is dead. No one posts. I am greatly concerned as I have become chemicaly dependant on the dry wittisms that once frequented your site. I fear that if they do not return I will be forced to turn to tobacco or even alchol to fill the void. Of course, you could always jazz things up by reintroducing a former blogger (myself). Horkins, soon it will be too late, The circumcised Dick P.S. please excuse any spelling errors" William, I hear you brutha. I haven't been posting lately because I don't have a whole lot to post about. And no one else (except maybe the occasional Cooplander post which just haven't been the same lately, since he ended the story and the quotes...) posts at all. Any and all spelling errors and profanity is excused as you are right to point out the "deadness" of Flounder Online. In this rainy summer, we are experiencing a drought. But don't call the preacher yet, it ain't over. Peeps is just too caught up in the whole summer-ness of it all to bother to stop by and tag this ol' brick wall. And if you feel it necessary, jazz away my friend. If you go to Blogger.com and log in to your old account you'll find I never actually cut you, just said I did and went home. So let's not let the laid backness of the summer, or as I call it: "SunnyTime", stop us from layin back a spell and posting at our favourite blog: Flounder Online. PS- Turn to??? Let the good times and dry witticisms roll.

I HATE ADS!!!!!!!! Every time I check the site I get bombarded by ad after ad after ad... for every ad I close another opens! There used to be just 3 ads. Now it takes me 5 minutes to close all the ads. There I'm finished on that. Sorry for not posting for a while. Life has been kinda hectic. Went up to Guelph the other day to meet some friends I hadn't seen in a while and I found the funniest spot in all of Guelph. White Trash Corner!! At the corner of Benton and King in Guelph there is constantly at least 10 people on this corner just hanging out. Not just regular people, but hicks, you could take a picture of any of them and put it beside the definition of hick in the dictionary. I'm talking wife beaters, all forms of facial hair, drinking booze from paper bags and skanky bitches. I sat across the seat and watched their antics for around 1/2 hour. During that time: 4 fights broke out, 3 drunks stumbled around, 2 arguments between two different white trash couples (of which the content was extrememly entertaining) and 1 passed out hick. All within half an hour. I passed by the place in my car 2 more times that day and there were always different people but always the same type of hicks. I could have just sat there watching them all day. Funny thing is I don't think any of them were homeless. I'm pissed that I missed SARSTOCK. Looked like a lot of fun. TV coverage blew ass. Most of it was just stupid video segments. I got bored and turned it off. AC DC sounded awesome though. My friends who were there said they stole the show (sorry "JUSTIN"). Just over 3 weeks till school starts back up "AHHHHHHHH!!!!!" Lates

Now if anyone had a night or a story that comes anywhere close to the wierdness of this night I'd like to hear about it. The Night The Lights Went Out This story starts on August 14th 2003; its around 4 oclock. Im at Royal Woodbine golf course fulfilling my shift of 2 close. At 4:12 pm on that day the power went out! At 5 oclock it was still out. I was getting annoyed because I was hungry and I wanted food. At 6 oclock the power was still out. This was beginning to cause problems as I had to park carts. The problem is that the carts have to be parked underground. This means that I have to try and park these carts in the dark. Most golf courses are very cheap and Royal Woodbine is no exception. There were no flashlights anywhere on the course. So I was forced to try and park using the light of a disposable camera. As you can tell this proved difficult as a camera can be only so useful as a flashlight. During the parking I was able to crash numerous times and caused some damage to the carts (obviously I hid these carts in the back). By 7 oclock everyone has realized that the lights were going to be out for at least the night. My co-workers and I had been able to acquire 8 cans of Alexander Keiths finest brew to last us through the night. I had an inkling that this would not be an adequate enough amount of alcohol. So I devised a plan, which you will learn of later. By 8 oclock the sun was beginning to set. I already called my parents and let them know that I would be coming home late and that I would be getting a ride home. This was the first step of my plan. At about 8:30 the snack girl came in off the course. I decided that in order to get what I wanted Id have to involve myself in some trickery. I helped her park her cart since she was parking in the dark. I then helped her unload all the garbage and leftover food and booze back into the food room. After I was done I asked her if I could help myself to a drink and a bag of chips, she agreed to this. So she gave me the keys to the room and I helped myself to a hieny and a bag of chips. At this point I offered to lock the room for her, since she was done. She once again agreed. I closed the door, took out the keys, but I did not lock the door. I simply acted like I did. At 9 oclock the last staff cart came in, which happened to have headlights on it. At 9:30 all the carts were parked and the night was over or so it seemed. I told my compadres of my plan. You see since the restaurant upstairs could not make food they closed up at 8. And due to the power outage, the security cameras did not work and then I told them about the food storage room trick. So there were no security cameras, no one left but us, and an unlimitless supply of booze and food. We quickly went to work on the beers we had taken earlier. By 10 we had finished these and had each had about 3 beers each. Not much yet. We then headed into the storage room and stumbled around for around 5 minutes due to the lack of lights looking for the perfect alcoholic beverage. We ended up coming out with two 12 oz. Bottles of vodka and some orange juice. We mixed these two drinks together had many shots and by 10:30 I was mildly wasted off my ass. By now we were thinking of ways to have fun. Suddenly all eyes turned to the cart with headlights. All three of us jumped on this cart as quickly as three drunken 17 20 year olds can. With me at the wheel I knew something exciting was going to occur, I just didnt know what it was going to be yet. I was able to make the first turn out towards the golf course. I couldnt actually tell how fast I was going or where I was going. I thought I was on the path but I guess I was wrong because before I knew it I was slamming on the brakes attempting to keep my cart from careening into the river in the middle of the first fairway. Our cart stopped within inches of the first rocks guarding the river. This aint no sissy river. We would have lost that fn cart. It would have floated over to Lake Pollution, sorry, Ontario. Now must people would have realized at this point that they were a little wasted. But as you all know I am not most people. So we continued on our little journey. We almost crashed another 5 times. Each time within inches of the certain demise of our jobs. We got back at around 11:15 (I just realized what an amazing itinerary this is for a guy that was wasted off his ass). We were walking back to my buddys car when he had an idea. You know how they drive hole in one cars out on the course once in a while? Why dont we drive MY car onto the course!!! We quickly agreed to this obviously retarded idea. So we all piled into his Maxima. I wasnt who I was more afraid of having behind the wheel, Dan or myself. Within 30 seconds of this trip Dan almost drove his car into the pond beside the 18th green. We then made our way up the 18th fairway heading into the course, when we stopped by the 17th green and decided to do some putting in the dark. While they were putting I decided that I wanted to drive. So I opened the door, the keys were still in and I turned the ignition. Immediately, I have one of my usual moronic ideas and I decide that I am going to lock my friends out and drive backwards back up the 18th fairway. Well my friends gave chase and I slowed down for them to catch up. Dan grabbed onto the drivers side and Mark grabbed onto the passenger side doors, but I did not open the doors. I simply gave them the chance to grab onto something before I sped up and dragged them back towards the clubhouse. Take a second to imagine this scene, two people holding on for dear life to a car driving backwards up a fairway on a golf course. I was actually able to successfully drive back into the parking lot with the car unscathed. When I stopped the car my friends were laughing hysterically. Partly because they survived and partly because that was some pretty fucked up shit. I unlocked the door and Dan drove us all home to enjoy the rest of our night without power. THE END OK, Bateman now that is a summer story, and I didn't even need rednecks. And I've been wondering Bateman, what kind of flow do u have? "Oh no! Not me! We never lost control." The Man Who Sold The World - Nirvana The last quote was written by David Bowie but Nirvana's version is better E=Mc2 Whoaaa studies!! Lates!!

Ok Bishop, I know that I am going to get ridiculed for this, but I am going to enter the story contest, it probably sucks but here goes... I'm at a buddies place for the weekend in early July. We're chilling in his pool house when the CD we're listening to stops, but there still is this loud music in the background. We stop and listen to it for a bit, and finally recognize it for some sort of jam. Now, previous encounters with local parties has been pretty good, laid back and just generally a pretty good time. So we keep following the sound, it looks like it is coming from a neighbouring lot so we take some nature path till we find the origin of the sound. We keep walking on and come to the back of what looks like a small house, with lights ablaze and music blaring. However, we soon realize that there are some even smaller homes down the way. By the time we are in the middle of the howdown, we realize that it is precisely that, a howdown being put on by the not so friendly trailer park locals. Our time of realization came at a fairly in opportune time, as many people had stopped dancing and had turned their attention to the city boys that had just shown up. One gentleman even went as far to ask me where the Williams F1 trucking company was from (I think he was pretty serious). Another thing, all of them were white and the large majority of them were wearing wife beaters and had mullets, and the women looked as if they could drink McKell under the table to say the least (not to mention that they could kick the shit out of him). They did follow one fashion trend however, mesh hats. When we were asked to request a song I just said that I had to go to the washroom and we ran off pretty quickly. Anyway Bishop it may not sound too funny, but its true, and you now have your first story to grade. So I took one for the team so don't put me under too much ridicule, I endure enough everyday. - The day Bateman loses the flow, is the day the hair on Brad Adam's bald head grow!

"Hellllooooooooooooo!!!" I love seinfeld, great show. Anyways welcome to another edition of Cooper's Corner. Anyways, I'd like to apologize for posting the story about ed. I know some people found it entertaining and funny, but this site should not be used to further grudges. Being able to post on this site is a privilege and my post was not "honourable." Anyways I'll try to keep the personal grudges off the site from now on. Non-wrestling fans skip the next section. I'd like to quickly pay tribute to two amazing men who died over the weekend. Firstly, Stu Hart the father and trainer of Bret and Owen Hart died this weekend of pneumonia. He was a great man respected by everyone in the industry. He trained people such as his sons, Chris Jericho, Davey Boy Smith, Dynamite Kid, and Chris Benoit, as well as countless others. His effect on the industry will be forever felt. He was 82. I'd also like to pay tribute to the memory of Road Warrior member Hawk. Also known as the Legion of Doom, Animal and Hawk formed what is now known as the greatest tag team in history. He worked in the WWF in the late 80's and the early 90's. Their tag team was so popular and their gimmick so unique Vince McMahon copied the gimmick before they came to the WWF. Road Warrior Hawk aka Michael Hegstrand died in his sleep on Sunday. He was 45. Its a tragedy when someone so young is taken from this earth. Another great man. (For more info on these two men head to www.411mania.com/wrestling. Some cool theatre presentations, highlighted by a rare performance by Matt Cowie and Chris Horkins. The entire IB1 theatre class watched so we had a large audience. Made me feel hot and uncomftorable. But I didn't fuck up my presentation so I was happy. For those of you who came here just to read up my post on ed look down a few posts. As well I'm working on the fight between Cowie and Bateman. I took the WWE approach and have used JR and King as announcers. Expect it to be finished in the next week. Peppers deserves to be #1, but Pet Sounds (the albulm that influenced Sgt. Peppers) doesn't deserve to be #2. Top ten maybe (cause it led to so much more...) but Dark Side of the Moon definetly deserves to be in the Top 3 at least. But not fucking #43, that albulm is so mega, it is an experience to listen to it to it through its entiretity. It had such a profound impact on me that I still remember the first time I listened to it, a wave of indescribeable feelings come over you, it is just that good, it certainly deserves to be mentioned in the same sentence as Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band. The thing that disgusts me most is that they rate David Bowie higher than it and the Door's debut. If you have never listened to the Doors, do it right fucking now, they are so brilliant! If you think that Tupac 'paints a picture' with his brutal honesty, then listen to Riders On the Storm , the last song recorded by Jim Morrison and it just makes you think how good they could have been, had the press not shit on them and Jim Morrison made his subsequent trip to Paris, we all know how it ends, and if you don't then fuck off. Jim was a poet first, musician second. Don't even get me started on ranking a fucking Michael 'there's an innocence with sleeping in the same bed as little boys' Jackson's thriller. Some peeps may say that that is a good albulm, but it can't compete with The Doors and Dark Side, and MJ the 'innocence' you are refering to is illegal, stop taking the roids, all I gotta say. Im going to make a pretty bold statement Mr Griffin is going to disagree with big time, but Jim Morrison was a better lyricist than Dylan, he just had a such a way with words and music, and both of these albulms beat the fuck out of anything Bruce Springsteen ever did and ever will, yet they are ranked higher than these two pivotal albulms in the history of music. Don't even get me started about modern music, the #1 selling albulm of the decade is way off in like the 300s (Oasis' What's the Story Morning Glory), and I will not get into that cause that albulm was as big as Nirvana's Nevermind and beat the fuck out of anything done by U2 in the 90s. So Rolling Stone's list fucking sucks, and "I'll tell you kids.. I'd rather walk." "But when it comes to do the line on top. You gotta make it happen..."
