urlLink RollingStone's 500 Greatest Albums of All Time Once again, bateman knows more about this stuff, but lemme take a crack at it. I'm not sure I really agree with this list. While "Sergeant Pepper" is a great album, it's a little to experimental to be number one. I definitely think that a different Beatles album could have occupied that spot, like Revolver or Rubber Soul. But really the problem is that this list has too much of the Beatles. Pretty much EVERY beatles album is in the top 100 (even Meet The Beatles for christ sake). And the stones top album is at like 7, you'd expect better from the greatest rock and roll band of all time right? And 2 is like "the beach boys"... This list has too much classic rock. I know it's great and all but the highest rap album is Public Enemy's "It Takes A Nation of Millions To Hold Us Back". This album is a classic. Just looking at some of the song titles, you realize what a classic this is: "Bring Tha Noize", "Rebel Without a Pause", "Party For Your Right To Fight", "Cold Lampin With Flavor". The unstoppable duo of Chuck D and Flavor Flav bring the noise with attitude on this album. It represents the struggle of rap artists in the 80s when rap was just becoming popular. 48 is an insult to PE. But what is a greater insult is the other rap on the chart. The next highest is RUN-DMC's (arguably the greatest rap group of all time) "Raising Hell" probably their best album, at 120. And then just behind the soundtrack to Saturday Night Fever Soundtrack is Notorious BIG's "Ready To Die" which is, in my opinion, the greatest rap album ever produced, only at 133. Dr. Dre's "The Chronic" a west-side classic, isbeat out by Elton John's Greatest Hits at 137. The landmark "Straight Outta Compton" by NWA sits at 144, beat out by murderer Phil Spector's christmas album. I didn't really go past 200 but thats all the rap sub-200. Which is pathetic. Rolling Stone is too pussy and old fashioned to put rap music, the most innovative form of music in the past 100 years, higher than 48 and they stick timeless classics in joke spots up in the high 100's... this list sucks.

urlLink The Top 102 Songs of The 90's Before you click on this link, let me sum up what Edge thinks of the 90's. The number one song is apparently RHCP's "Under The Bridge", which I won't disagree with, it's a great song I just didn't expect it to be the number one (at 2 is Nirvana's "Smells Like Teen Spirit"). The list is very heavy on RHCP, Nirvana, U2, The Hip and Radiohead. For example, the top ten is RHCP, Nirvana, Smashing Pumpkins, Blur, RHCP, Foo Fighters, Beastie Boys, Weezer, RHCP and Nirvana. With so many repeat artists it becomes more of an "oh there's another Pearl Jam song" kind of list. And there's a severe lack of Oasis! The fact that Radiohead's "Creep" is only 68 and that ahead of it at 67 is Creed's "Higher" (ugh..) practically discounts the whole list. But all in all it's a good representation of the 90's era rock music. Holler at it. Bateman, you know more about this kind of music, maybe u wanna holler at it. PAYCE

It seems the on-page ads are gone. Hopefully for good. Cause I was not about to go to the trouble of moving the site. A lot of people have been asking about this story so... By Popular Demand... Here is the Story that won the halloween contest and got me a standing ovation in assembly (a dream I never thought I would fulfill... The Scariest Halloween Pumpkin!!! By Chris Horkins This story is awesome, and by awesome I mean totally scary. This story is about two guys who are best friends. Their names are Eric and Jamaal. Eric and Jamaal had one thing in common: they both freakin loved Halloween. When school started Eric would be all like Yo Jamaal, Halloween is like totally 2 months away! and Jamaal would be all like For real dawg, I cant wait! This happened pretty much every day until finally when Eric checked his daily organizer for the date he went to Jamaal and was all like Halloween is like totally tomorrow! and Jamaal was too speechless so he kinda just stood there for 3 and a half minutes until Eric finally said We need to get ready! They both skipped school that day, which was pretty gangster if you ask me. First, they hit up the candy store. They figured they would get mad candy for free on Halloween so they didnt buy any but still looked at it... Then they hit up the costume store. They both dressed up and got their costumes, which were sweet. Eric was a ninja. Jamaal was DMX. The next stop was more of an accident. They went to this store that looked really spooky and sweet but it turned out it was full of these 32 year old virgins wearing black makeup, playing Magic Cards, and saying things like All Hallows Eve is a festival of evil and the devil! Eric and Jamaal were all like Pssssht we are so out of here and left. They wondered what else they would need. Finally Eric said Cho guy! A pumpkin! Not just any pumpkin, the scariest Halloween pumpkin ever! On the way to the pumpkin store, Eric and Jamaal encountered a crazy thing. It was a talking pumpkin. The pumpkin rolled up beside them and went BOO! Eric and Jamaal were scared. This had to be the scariest Halloween pumpkin ever. They picked it up and took it home. They would look so cool if they had this pumpkin so they trapped it and kept it in Erics garage. Halloween night rolled around. Eric put on his totally awesome ninja costume. He was ready to ROCK (or ready for bed)! Jamaal was lookin fly in his pimptight DMX outfit complete with Cradle2ThaGrave T-shirt. They took their talking pumpkin out his cage, which they made from a Nintendo64 box and some duct tape, and decided to have some fun. They placed the talking pumpkin, who they named 50-Cent, on a deserted street corner and said to it 50, listen up. When some kid dressed as something lame, like a pirate, walks by, you have to really scare him so he soils himself. If you succeed everyone will be all like holy crap! The pumpkin was not pleased. My name is not 50-Cent. It is VineDemon the Damnd! I am not a part of your childish schemes. I am an emissary from the deepest depths of Hell. You will pay for your disrespect! At first, Eric and Jamaal were like Yeah, sure 50-cent, just scare the pirates but then 50 started growing until he was as big as a Cadillac Escalade (on 24-inch rims!). Fire belched forth from his gaping jaws as if they were the gates of hell themselves. Eric soiled himself. You have disrespected Satan on his sacred night of evil. You will experience the true meaning of suffering in the seventh circle of Hell! Satan himself will be- Just in time, a huge Cadillac Escalade (on 28 inch rims) ran over the pumpkin and squashed him spraying pumpkin parts all over the street. In the Escalade was, who else but DMX himself, who thought that Jamaals costume was so awesome and sweet that he gave them a ride to the richest hood where every house gave out like full chocolate bars and you never got raisins. It was the best Halloween ever. THE END Word Count: 666

After a long Flounder hiatus, I attempted a revolutionary "live as it happens" post as bishy's theatre party a few days ago. Sadly, due to his unergonomic mouse, that glorious post was deleted. This one comes in response to Horkins' pitiful plea and the fact that I just returned from a pretty boring night. After some good pratting with booth and bish, we went to Daisy's house for awhile. It was pretty boring, but Daisy is a cute girl and I schooled her in pool. I am just waiting for some...stuff...to download so I decided to prat up the blog. I could sense that flounder has missed my erudite charm, after a long drought sprinked only with cooper's idiocy and bateman's incoherant rants. I really wish I could provide some right now, but my senses are slightly dulled. However, I think I know what we all enjoy at 1:26 AM......................................a six line play! Setting - A party. Drugs and alcohol abound. Loud music blares. CHRIS is smoking some CHRONS and recieves a phone call from his DAD THE JUDGE. CHRIS: (coughs) Uh....H-hello? DAD THE JUDGE: Christopher? This is your father, the judge. You haven't gotten arrested again, have you? Your mother and I were just casually rifling through your underwear drawer and we discovered some shocking paraphernalia. Nestled betwixt your boxer briefs was a visibly mangled copy of "Fat Titties Quarterly" , a small bottle of anal lube and a sock full of what appears to be cannabis marijuana. Suffice to say, we are alarmed. CHRIS: Uh...those aren't mine!! I'm, um, holding them for Bateman! DAD THE JUDGE: Hmmm... I'm skeptical. I want to believe you. So I will. I always knew that Ian Bateman was a no-goodnik. Something about those agressive shoes he wears... Nevertheless, your mother and I are placing you in a two-year drug and sex rehabilitation camp. You'll love it. It's in Kitchener and its run by a group of French-Canadian nuns. You leave tomorrow. CHRIS: B-but Dad! Tomorrow is my beloved dog, Scraps' birthday! I bought him a new collar! DAD THE JUDGE: Hmmm... Yes, I forgot to tell you, I backed over Scraps this morning on the way to work. See you at dinner. *click* End Scene I hope you enjoyed that as much as I enjoyed the 10 minutes I spent writing it. Hopefully, this show of force will entice fellow aficionados like alex bishop to post. Oh, and also I think we should give Tapscott posting rights. He can spin a good yarn and spends a lot of time in front of the computer. If you know what I mean. In the meantime, I'm off to haunt the night. Peace kiddies.

I had a pretty chillan time last nite at this Jackie Humphrey party, which I wasn't invited to but Glace dragged me too anyways and it was pretty fun until the cops showed up and I got all scared and decided to leave. But anyways I gotta say it's been pretty jamming since school got out. Holler! Peep grads2004 for some pictures of what's been pratting lately. So here's my verdict on both my new albums: The Black Album: This is a sick album. If every artist could only put this kind of effort into making a good album, WITHOUT having to retire after then it would be a perfect world. Jay-Z really wants to go out with a bang and he does. This album has a dream team of producers working on it including Just Blaze, Eminem, Kanye West, Timbaland, The Neptunes, and Rick Rubin (!!!). I have to say my favourite track is "Lucifer" the Kanye West track, I also like "Change Clothes", "Moment of Clarity", "99 Problems" fuckit... I like the whole damn thang. Speakerboxxx/The Love Below: Speakerboxxx is basically the same ol' crunkin, dirrrrrrty south type hip-hop we've come to expect from OutKast. Big Boi continues this on really well, and he tries to innovate a bit but sticks to the formula. He shows that he is able to hold it down without Andre3000. The ATL is well represented. I love the track with Lil Jon called "Last Call" and "GhettoMusick" is also great. The Love Below is where this double album really shines. Andre3000, despite being one of the greatest rappers of our time, sings almost the whole album in a crazy falsetto type voice. The album is pretty much all about... well... sex. You can tell dre spent a lot of time planning out what he was gonna say. He raps occasionally, but the non-rap tracks don't disappoint. The slow jams are sick, the fast jams are sick. It's not just "Hey Ya!" either. I'm lovin this whole album, especially "Roses", "Happy Valentines Day", "Dracula's Wedding", "Vibrate". It's great. Album of the year for Love Below alone, SpeakerBoxxx just makes it better. Cop it! If U haven't already, and u're thinking about it, go cop these two albums. Cause they rule.
oh one more thing.... Greatest show right now: The Simple Life. Paris Hilton and Nicole Richie living in Hicktown USA. It's fuckin funnier than u would ever imagine a reality show could be. Watch it.

UCC Exam Marathon Geography Okay, so going into this exam I had one thing in mind "I'm doing the structured questions on drainage and coasts, not the essays". And what happens? I do an Essay on drainage and a structured on Urban/Settlements. The thing with paper 2 was that the structureds were really specific and full of "define this" and "affluvial" that so I did a money essay on flooding. Mississipi case study, Bangladesh case study, blingin. And then the structured on urban was skeeeeeeeetch. I did examples from Mexico (i hope they were real) and Toronto (the projects, urban sprawl). Sketchiness. I didn't wanna touch Coasts cause that page was just fucke up, missing a question, one part was about rivers instead of coasts, etc. etc. But my answer on paper 1 was MONEY in tha bank. It was so easy to mix and match the countries. So aside from paper 2's sketchyness, this exam was kinda chillin, but my hand hurt after from so much writing... jeez. Chillness Rating : 3.9 Klons out of 5 LAST EXAM TOMMORROW! YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEAH!!!!!!!!

I've been looking over our little "90's rock debate" and it is very clear that it's possibly the most boring thing we've talked about pretty much ever. It was fun at first makin lists an all but now I think we have to do as my illustration suggests: As administrator of the blog, here is my decree. This debate sucks. Everyone is allowed 1 more post on it so speak your peace. Then we find somethin new. No one cares if Radiohead is better than coldplay or if nirvana is better than oasis... at least i dont anymore.

Finally! Someone agrees with me! Courtney Love that crazy bitch killed Kurt! I think I wrote about that before though so I'll spare you my preaching and talking... if you want to read more about this go to Tom Grant's website urlLink . Ok Chris. I hear you, the RS rating gave Nevermind a 3 star rating, but have you read the actual review? It is a fucking Nirvana love fest and if you look one disc up you'll see that In Utero was given 4 stars. Now doesn't that seem weird? I'd say most people agree that Nevermind was a better album then In Utero, but according to these RS ratings it is not. As well, if you look at the Rolling Stone top 500 albums, hmm... what's at 17? Why it's Nevermind! But how could Rolling Stone which gave the album a 3 star rating rate it so high? You see rolling stone doesn't pay attention to the ratings given back in 1991 and neither should you. Now I'll admit I love Radiohead. In fact I'm listening to them right now, but their influence was not anywhere near as grand as Nevermind. And Bateman I never want you to mention album sales again. Never. In fact I feel like disproving that whole argument right now. First you have to look at who the album was made for. Nevermind was made for true fans of Nirvana, it was not made to sell x million copies of the CD. He made it for a certain type of fan. And that album appealed to that fan, but as a happenstance it gained a large following throughout the world. Oasis on the other hand made an album that seemingly appealed to everyone, adults, children, teenagers, everyone, so more people bought their cd. Nirvana did not appeal to the adult generation, it did not appeal to children. This was music for teenagers. Teenagers don't have too much money, but the album still sold like hotcakes. Another point, look at when these albums were released, Nevermind was released in 1991, now if my memory serves me correctly (probably not) but the united states was just getting out of the Reagan era. So money was not readily available to everyone. Now look at when WTSMG was released, 1995. Economy everywhere was recovering people had money to spend. So don't use the argument anymore about album sales. Album sales mean shit all. Anyways I've said enough about this. "When masturbations lost its fun, you're fucking breaking!" Green Day - "Longview" Thought I was gonna quote Nirvana eh Coops has left the building.

Let me explain why Nevermind is not on my list of top 5 modern rock albums. The thing is, I really do not "get" the whole Nirvana thing. They were a good band, and they put out some very good music. Were they the greatest thing ever? Were they something really special? In my opinion: Not really... "Smells Like Teen Spirit" is a classic song but definitely NOT the best song the 90's produced. After some deliberation, I'm gonna have to hand it to "Under The Bridge", or Weezer's "Say It Ain't So". Nirvana is significant because they represent the whole "grunge" movement of the 90's, which produced a lot of really shitty music and some good music like Nirvana, Green Day, etc. Why not Oasis? Me and bateman disagree on Oasis a lot... I think they are as much of a great band as the next guy. He thinks they are mega. Don't get me wrong cause they are really awesome, but they are not by far the second Beatles. The Bends is my number one album because Radiohead is no question the most innovative rock band of the last decade, and The Bends is the solidest album they ever put out. I know we all were shitting on rolling stone a while back but I checked their reviews of our top albums and I pretty much agree with them. Nevermind is 3 stars, good, nothing special. What's The Story nabbed 4 stars, great album, solid. The Bends, as you can prolly guess was a 5-star album, which RS doesn't just hand out all the time (actually the RS site says 4 stars but they lie because I saw the magazine where they reviewed it) And Bateman, your V-sign is a gang sign so SHUTUP.... ssssss.

Coops, (Whats the Story) Morning Glory? by Oasis deserves to be the #1 album of the modern era. Yes Nevermind is a great album, and will forever be remembered. Both albums are equal in terms of significance, both embodied the sounds of a generation, both are brilliantly written, Smells Like Teen Spirit is definetly the best song of the decade. But when it comes down to sheer popularity and album sales, nothing beats (Whats the Story) Morning Glory? . When writing my list, they were first tied, but then when you consider the hype behind Oasis at that time, it just nosed ahead. People were calling them the second Beattles, the future of rock and roll, Noel Gallagher even stated that he needed Oasis' first album to be the biggest thing since, Nevermind , other wise he felt that it would not be worth doing, Definetly Maybe was the biggest album to come out since Nevermind, and (What's the Story) Morning Glory just went that needed bit extra. Just like Nevermind you can listen to the entire album from start to finish, and there were 6 top 10 hits on it, when the album only had 10 real songs (two of them were interludes), two of the singles went platinum (600,000 units sold), and there were 7 songs that went #1 in various countries. Serious numbers to say the least. When it came out many journalists hailed it to be the first definite rock album of the decade. All of this just inched it ahead of Nevermind , which was left out of Horkin's list. But it would have been interesting to see what Nirvana could have come up with had Kurt not been killed (yes he was murdered, look at the evidence). Anyway thats my rant on music for the week. Give us an exam that shows what the fook we can do, not what fooks us up, and thank you for making fun of my grammar, and that really boosts my confindence, and i don't even know what a comma splice is. (I really don't). Anyway that artists depiction Horkins did for you should be framed, classic. The BSS grads site is the bomb. Apparently the V sign is a gang sign. Who knew? The pic of lace and the TV is priceless. "You could wait for a life time, to spend your days in the sunshine. You might aswell do the white line, cause when it comes on top.. You gotta make it happen!...."

To clarify my position on Jazz, I like it. I have nothing against it, except when Jazz comes and tells me that it was more influential than Hip-Hop, then me and Jazz got beef. Cause the thing is, while very innovative and blah blah blah Jazz was just a new way of using the same instruments to create music that sounded different but in the end its the same kind of sound. With hip-hop, you have the invention of new instruments (aka the turntable, etc., digital mixing) PLUS a whole new way of vocal expression that had really never been done before. I still believe that when we look back at the 20th century hip-hop will stand out as the most innovative form of music to come along. And yeah, in concept, hip-hop is based on jazz. Jazz was the first Harlem renaissance, and hip-hop was the second. There is heavy sampling from Marvin Gaye (im listening to it right now...), Steve Wonder, James Brown, and others. But that just adds to the innovation of hip-hop. I mean, sampling, remixing? That was huge. It's become such a big part of music now. Believe what u want, but this is my "position" on this issue, or whatever. But yeah, if u need a better explanation of this math exam (i realise that my first one was rather... brief), then I drew another picture... So, as you can see paper 1 is very similar to the french exam... paper 2 is much harder. I think the drawing speaks for itself. payce

Dear McG, You are quite correct in saying that LA Woman is better than The Doors' self titled debut. I felt that it should go ahead of LA Woman, just based on sheer significance and impact. But then again, this contradicts Mr. Bob Dylan being put behind Jim and the boys, because without him there would never have been The Doors. My other feeling is that it was the Dylan experience, rather than his albums that made such an impact, while Highway 61 and Free Wheelin' are gems, are they as good an album as Dark Side of The Moon, or Sgt. Peppers? We're talking albums here. But agreed Dylan is a better songwriter than Morrison, it just happens that Riders on the Storm is one of my personal favourites. However one of my favourite modern day bands, is the Wallflowers, headed up by Jakob Dylan, Bob's son, and there is a little bit of a carry over between father and son, if you haven't heard them definetly worth a look, especially Bringing Down the Horse, great stuff. I do invite your rebutal, and have to commend you on your analogy of Dylan and Morrison when they meet up in heaven (assuming Jim is there, and that Bob is going there). Thanks for the comments. Now about this Jazz notion that JJ has no fooking clue aboutl. I am not a huge cult follower of Jazz, like WT-Unit, but Jazz forms the fookin basis of hip/hop and R+B. What form first brought the bass and precussion together, and played them at the same time? Jazz! What is the backbone of Hip Hop and R+B? (and its not a computer) Its the bass and the drums, sorry but it just is, whether its a variant of the two, you can't have a beat without them. Fact of the matter is JJ in ten years if you look back at the twentieth century two things are gonna stand out, Jazz and the Beattles. Simple as that. Maybe in 2050 when we look back at the past 100 years, then we will see hip hop for more than it seems in retrospect today, but time will tell. Right now though, jazz beats form the basis of hip hop tracks, whether it takes up 0.1% of the beat, they're there in every single song, and more often than not rap and hip hop songs take their structure from jazz. Like it or not JJ it's true. Very True. And if you don't like jazz, that doesn't matter you still have to admitt it's importance. Louis Armstrong is the man.

I haven't checked tha feedback in a while so i apologise for tha lateness here. I got one that just made me angry, i was jus like "yo... what the fuck guy?" when I read it... You ever get that where ur just like "damn that was racist" but it actually wasnt racist it just made u mad... well yeah this is it: "Euh... I just looove Jazz" writes: "the most innovative form of music in the last 100 years is anything but rap. (jazz)" SHUT UP! You obviously do not know what ur talking about. Rap is sweet and by that I mean totally awesome. Let's look at the last hundred years of music, shall we... Okay so 100 years ago, your chillin, listening to the popular music of the time which apparently is Jazz (yeah I looked it up, what?), so u're peepin the newest track either "The Woodchuck Song" by Robert Hodart Davis or "The Beer That Made Milwaukee Famous" by Dan McAvoy an ur cool jus listening to it and so is everybody else. Just listening to your pianos and your trumpets and it's all good. Fast forward a couple decades and you get rock and roll, a bunch of black dudes start sangin' and playin guitars and tambourines and makin music and everyone is like "OH MY GOODNESS! What is that coloured man doin on tha stage?" And Rock and Roll becomes very contraversial, and only the kids like it but they dont tell their parents. Every self respecting white guy in the nation is afraid to like rock and roll... until this white dude named Elvis starts doin it, then it's okay. The 60's roll around and rock has become this big PROTEST thing. People are using music for Politics now and it's a pretty new concept. Suddenly the musicians have a bigger following than the politicians. John Lennon says he's bigger than Jesus and everyone's like "Did he just say he was bigger than Jesus?" Well yeah and if Jesus said he was bigger than the Beatles would u be shocked? No cause u dont go to church and u wouldnt care. But before u can care its the 70s and this thing called disco is here and everyone is dancing and bustin a groove. There are movies, and clubs, and fashion that goes with it. Very new, very hype. Alrite so around the end of the 70's, some black guys in New York start having these underground "rhyming contests" where one black guy tries uses rhymes to diss the other black guy to the beat of drums, very african type shit. Then they get the idea to add in a turntable, the art of DJ-ing is created. Together with MC-ing (rapping), B-boying (breakdancing), and graffiti (not vandalism, artistic graffiti) they make up this new culture known as "Hip-Hop". They start recording this shit and actually putting it on cassette and CD. And all of a sudden all the white dudes are like "Who is this GrandMaster Flash and the Furious Five" character?" None of the white people know what do. This shit is so different from anything anyone has ever heard. But the kids LOVE IT. Flash, Slick Rick, and others pave way for RUN-DMC. In 1984 Run-DMC records rap's first classic album (their self titled debut). But basically in the 80's rap is such a shock to the mainstream music system that its basically a very edgy type of music. By the early of the 90's you have several rap devoted record labels, the two primary ones being Suge Knight's LA based DeathRow Records featuring a cats like Snoop Doggy Dogg, Dr. Dre, and Tupac Shakur, and Sean "Puffy" Combs's NYC based BadBoy Entertainment featuring the hottest young star: The Notorious B.I.G. This results in a huge "gang war" and Gangsta Rap is suddenly huge. Pac gets shot. Biggie gets shot. Rap becomes mainstream. Suddenly all the kids that liked rap in the 80s are young adults. And all the old white dudes are still all like "Rap music? More like CRAP music!" But in the end it comes down to this: No genre has changed the public's perception of what "music" is more than rap. No other type of music has become this popular this fast. No other type of music was this innovative. In conclusion, you smell.

Yeah Fucking Blogger destroying my beautiful post. I was in the zone too.. I had huge lists full of great albums. Anyway here goes..... I extended it to the Top 10 cause I wanted to, and cause Im an inconclusive little shit. Top Ten Rap Albums: 1. Ready To Die - Notorious BIG 2. All Eyez on Me - 2pac 3. Raising Hell - RUN DMC 4. It Takes a Nation of Millions To Hold Us Back - Public Enemy 5. People's Instinctive Travels and The Paths of Rhythm - A Tribe Called Quest 6. Illimatic - Nas 7. Midnight Maurauders - A Tribe Called Quest 8. Grip It on That Other Level - Geto Boys 9. Eric B. and Rakim - Paid In Full 10. Me Against The World - 2pac Top Ten Classic Rock Albums: 1. Dark Side of the Moon - Pink Floyd 2. Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band - The Beattles 3. Who's Next - The Who 4. Revlover - The Beattles 5. II - Led Zeppelin 6. Let It Bleed - The Rolling Stones 6. Abbey Road - The Beattles 7. Wish You Were Here - Pink Floyd 8. The Doors - The Doors 9. Highway 61 - Bob Dylan 10. Are You Experienced? - The Jimmy Hendrix Experience Honorable Mentions: LA Woman - The Doors (Brilliant, Riders on the Storm is the best Doors song), American Woman - The Guess Who (a must have for any aspiring band), The Who - Quadrophenia , Led Zeppelin - IV , The Kinks - You Really Got Me (check out anything by the Kinks, great stuff), The Who - My Generation (a soundtrack for a generation, and the mods), Led Zeppelin - Houses of the Holly , The Rolling Stones - Sticky Fingers , Nick Drake - Pink Moon (a great album from a guy who none of you have probably heard of but everyone in the business has), anything by The Beattles , the list goes on and on..... Top Ten Modern Rock Albums 1. ( What's the Story?) Morning Glory - Oasis 2. Nevermind - Nirvana 3. The Bends - Radiohead 4. Definetly Maybe - Oasis 5. Weezer (Blue) - Weezer 6. Mellon Collie and the Infinite Sadness - The Smashing Pumpkins 7. Ok Computer - Radiohead 8. Heathen Chemistry - Oasis 9. Siamese Dream - The Smashing Pumpkins 10. Urban Hymns - The Verve Honorable Mentions: Be Here Now - Oasis (underated even by the band themselves, definetly worth a look some really good stuff on it), Is This It? - The Strokes (a great album, time will tell how great though), Kid A - Radiohead (a great concept album), Standing on the Shoulder of Giants - Oasis (a great album, has an almost psychadelic sound to it, really good stuff) Bringing Down The Horse - The Wallflowers (a great album with some unique lyrical and musical elements), Parachutes - Coldplay (seen by some to be ahead of it's time), Crash - Dave Matthews Band (a great album, anything by Dave is going to be good). There are two bands which I felt didn't fit into any of the categories outlined, but they definetly were two of the most influential. The Sex Pistols and The Clash , while some of you (including at times me) can't always take some of their songs, the definetly were great regardless what you think about their music. If you want to talk about albums having a message behind them you cannot exclude these two bands. "In the quiet words of the Virgin Mary, Come Again?"

Mentions: Life After Death - Notorious BIG, The Marshall Mathers LP - Eminem, Get Rich or Die Tryin - 50 Cent, Word of Mouf - Ludacris, Straight Outta Compton - N.W.A. Greatest Classic Rock Albums Of All Time 1. Revolver - The Beatles 2. Sticky Fingers - The Rolling Stones 3. Dark Side of The Moon - Pink Floyd 4. Led Zeppelin II - Led Zeppelin 5. American Woman - The Guess Who Hon. Mentions: Abbey Road - The Beatles, Back in Black - AC/DC, Who's Next - The Who, Slowhand - Eric Clapton, Are You Experienced? - Jimmy Hendrix Greatest Modern Rock Albums Of All Time 1. The Bends - Radiohead 2. What's The Story, Morning Glory? - Oasis 3. Weezer - Weezer 4. Fully Completely - The Tragically Hip 5. Mellon Collie and the Infinite Sadness - The Smashing Pumpkins Hon. Mentions: A Rush Of Blood To The Head - ColdPlay, OK Computer / Kid A / Amnesiac - Radiohead, Take Off Your Pants And Jacket -Blink-182, Blood Sugar Sex Magic - Red Hot Chili Peppers, Is This It -The Strokes So there you go... commence disagreement but this is what I say. I think it's time I throw myself to the dogs.... every other time I have released any writing I have been criticized en masse... So therefore I put up my shittly little sonnet to you all.... Be kind The Chili Grandeur Shadows slowly stretch themselves onto stage. Four different instruments are combined, Creating unique bliss no one else could find. Four different men who never show rage. Slithery licks are alive in the night; Melody has found the way to their heart. The mortality of a friend in part, Is why I hear them on this summer night. Their days as miscreants are done for good; Embracing the life they took for granted. Their love of life cannot be misunderstood Who knew that the group we love today, started With pain. Sublimely syncopated noise, The cure of everything that destroys. Just to let u all know... I hate sonnets... With a passion! I seem to have been once again the victim of a great post being deleted by blogger, or rather my forgetting to press "post" after writing it. My trip to Barbados was awesome, two weeks of lying on the beach, partying, lying on the beach, chillin sailboat rides and lying on the beach. If you haven't seen it yet, I do have blond hair now, thanks to the wonderful people behind Sun-In. Great product, really. If not for Will Dick's new shorter hair, AND beard (!!!) and JF "if we win three periods, then logically, we will win the game" Boucher's own blondness it might just be the craaaziest over the break change anyone made. So I'm lookin all nice and tanned, and I can't wait to chill and party with all my homies from the T-Dot again. Holler! Spence, I love the play, where the fuck do you get these ideas? I thought your character was based on me for a while, but I don't have a dog named scraps... On a final note, I got a 90 on my systems exam! Man... nine-fuckin-zero. HOLY SHIT! That's a 7, in my worst subject. This brings my mark up to 5+! Unfortunately it was really the only pleasant surprise today. Geo was basically what I could have expected, some nice marks and some not so nice marks, overall I ended up with 80, a solid way to round off an above average term for me. And math I ended up with a 79... which pretty much squashed all hopes of getting a 7, even though thats a solid 6 on our exam mark band... hopefully English will pull through, I fucking want a 7... just one, so i can be all like, yeah... I got a 7. To round off the shit-factor, Vanditz has not handed in ANY of his labs, and he has a 6, a higher mark than me, who has all my labs in. WHAT THE FUCK!? Dear Badass Dr. Hamr, I like you, but this is bullshit. I also checked grads04... I apparently missed some fun-looking shit... man there needs to be a party this week! PEACE OUT!

Well seeing as I'm stuck at home sick, and really, really, really bored. I thought I'd enlighten you all with my Oscar picks (for all categories, oh baby)... Best Picture Lord of The Rings: Return of The King Lost in Translation Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World Mystic River Seabiscuit should win : Lord of The Rings. Aside from it being the only one I saw (technically I saw half of Seabiscuit on a plane and thought it was boring) it should win this award for the whole trilogy. When you put those three movies together it's a piece of movie history. As long as the academy doesn't once again throw it away to the big forgettable tearfest drama (ie, Mystic River) then LOTR will be able to clean up and win for all those great sci-fi/fantasy movies that should have won (cough STARWARS...) will win: Lord of The Rings... see above. was robbed: Finding Nemo. Great movie, made a bunch of money, snubbed cause it was animated. Pirates of the Caribbean too. Fuck Cold Mountain, it probably sucked... And Old School, the greatest movie of our time. Best Actor Johnny Depp - PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN: THE CURSE OF THE BLACK PEARL Ben Kingsley - HOUSE OF SAND AND FOG Jude Law - COLD MOUNTAIN Bill Murray - LOST IN TRANSLATION Sean Penn - MYSTIC RIVER should win : Johnny Depp. Pirates was sick movie. Johnny Depp made it sick almost singlehandedly. You gotta give props when a dude can make a frickin PIRATE look this awesome. He's almost as awesome as a ninja. will win: If they're cool, Bill Murray. Bill Murray is the coolest guy ever. Although he was probably better in Caddyshack, or even Rushmore, odds are he won't be nominated again so now is the time. If they're gonna be stupid again then Sean Penn (I Am Sam was the worst movie ever made). was robbed: Elijah Wood. Does nobody else think that he holds LOTR together as Frodo? Among all the tough guys like Viggo Mortenson's Aragorn he plays the gentler, more self aware Frodo (a character you can actually relate to) perfectly. Also my boy Luke Wilson for Old School. Best Actress Keisha Castle-Hughes -WHALE RIDER Diane Keaton - SOMETHING'S GOTTA GIVE Samantha Morton - IN AMERICA Charlize Theron - MONSTER Naomi Watts - 21 GRAMS should win: I just think it would be cool if the 13 year old girl wins for Whale Rider... will win: but it's pretty much a sure bet that the academy will give it (for the 3rd year in a row, remember Halle Berry, Nicole Kidman) to the hot chick wearing makeup and a fake nose to make her look ugly, Charlize Theron. was robbed: Hilary Duff in the Lizzie McGuire movie... i dunno why... just... yeah... Best Supporting Actor Alec Baldwin - THE COOLER Benicio Del Toro - 21 GRAMS Djimon Hounsou - IN AMERICA Tim Robbins - MYSTIC RIVER Ken Watanabe - THE LAST SAMURAI should win: this year's nominees look like team ethnic. you got a latino guy (who is a mad ill actor, already won for Traffic tho), a huge black guy (shouldve been nommed for Amistad), a japanese guy (crazy samurai movie actor), amd two white guys one of which should win. Alec Baldwin. will win: Tim Robbins. was robbed: Sean Astin. Sam was huge in the third LOTR movie and he had a really powerful performance. Also Will Ferrell for Old School, which was lovely. Best Supporting Actress Shohreh Aghdashloo - HOUSE OF SAND AND FOG Patricia Clarkson - PIECES OF APRIL Marcia Gay Harden - MYSTIC RIVER Holly Hunter - THIRTEEN Rene Zellweger - COLD MOUNTAIN should win: The Iranian chick from the house movie... yeah the first one. will win: Renee Zellweger, why is she a high profile actress???? was robbed: no beef here... Best Director Fernando Meirelles-CITY OF GOD Peter Jackson-THE LORD OF THE RINGS Sofia Coppola-LOST IN TRANSLATION Peter Weir-MASTER AND COMMANDER Clint Eastwood-MYSTIC RIVER should win: Fernando! City of God is an ill movie I'm gonna go see right now... no really its about the ghettos and all the hard stuff that happens in Rio... very street. will win: there are a lot of the academy's favourite names here but Peter Jackson will definitely get his greasy hobbit hands on this statue. was robbed: Todd Phillips for Old School... genius Animated Feature Film BROTHER BEAR FINDING NEMO THE TRIPLETS OF BELLEVILLE should win : Finding Nemo. As cowie said "it was cute", in my own words "it was fuckin awesome!" will win : Probably Finding Nemo. If they're gonna be weird about it, it might go to that french one... the triplets... weird. was robbed : was there a pokemon movie this year??? Best Original Song "Belleville Rendez-vous" - THE TRIPLETS OF BELLEVILLE "Into the West" - THE LORD OF THE RINGS: THE RETURN OF THE KING "A Kiss at the End of the Rainbow" - A MIGHTY WIND "Scarlet Tide" - COLD MOUNTAIN "You Will Be My Ain True Love" - COLD MOUNTAIN should win : none of them. they all suck. will win : the enya song from LOTR... i dont care. and don't they mean "one" true love... weird was robbed : when eminem won last year I thought the academy had come a long way from randy newman and phil collins but this just proves we're back in the land of shitty music made for movies, here is a list of better nominees. Shake Ya Tailfeather - BAD BOYS II that is all. Visual Effects THE LORD OF THE RINGS: THE RETURN OF THE KING MASTER AND COMMANDER: THE FAR SIDE OF THE WORLD PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN: THE CURSE OF THE BLACK PEARL should win: LOTR will win: LOTR, did the other movies even have special effects? was robbed: The Matrix sequels, even tho they were shitty, they had awesome special effects. ... wow I lied, all the other categories are boring. so now that I'm actually awake (wow, its 5 PM...) I'll say something about Hockey Night... First off the House Hockey All Star Game kicked shit off at 3. The incredibly stacked North Team of Mow, McQ's (the q-unit), Brem, Jackson's, and Wedd's demolished the pitiful South squad of Howard's, Scadding's, Seaton's, Martland's and Orr's with a final score of 13-2 or something crazy like that. I racked up 2 insane points, 1 asisst to canella and 1 amazing goal asissted right into my shoulder from Pratscott. Then we all left and came back several hours later for the UCC/SAC game in which PRATTTT-ash (aka jeff morash) did play (idiot...). UCC performed the equivalent of an atomic wedgie to SAC scoring 4 unanswered goals in the shut out of the year. The game ended with the biggest fight I have ever seen at a UCC hockey game. As JF Boucher put it "They hate us, we hate them. It's all good." After stuffing the whole team into the penalty box they decided not to play the last 2.2 seconds and the UCC Blues were declared victorious. As for the afterparty... it was at some sketchy bar which I didn't go to so I'll let someone else handle that. I chilled at Jrobs's house for a bit, on the verge of passing out (this is why i dont regret so much not going to the "afterparty"...) my tiredness was so overcoming that when I got home i just passed out in my bed. But anyways, hockey night at Ricoh was not as good as the ACC but still a great time had by all. The end

Once again it seems that the Grammy Awards have fucked up big time. I give them mad props for giving the album of the year to OutKast, they deserve it big time but they fucked up pretty much everything else (fifty goes home empty handed???) so I've left it up to myself to right the wrongs with... FOL Presents The "Real" Grammy Awards Album Of The Year Get Rich or Die Tryin' - 50 Cent Chocolate Factory - R. Kelly The Black Album - Jay-Z A Rush of Blood To The Head - ColdPlay Speakerboxxx/The Love Below - OutKast Of course the winner of this category is 50 Cent . The biggest selling album of 2003 is also the best. Speakerboxxx/The Love Below is a great concept album but it can't touch the intensity of 50's beyond gangster debut. RKelly had the comeback of the century with Chocolate Factory and deserves to be recognised. And none of this blueprint 2 shit, The Black Album is Jay's best album since Reasonable Doubt and it did come out in 03. And Coldplay is just an ill band. Record Of The Year Get Low - Lil Jon and The East Side Boyz The Scientist - ColdPlay Hey Ya! - OutKast In Da Club - 50 Cent Cadillac On 22's - David Banner It goes to Hey Ya! but all these songs are equally more deserving than Clocks (which is such a shitty song compared to The Scientist). Get Low was easily the biggest song of the summer so it deserves to be up there. Lose Yourself, not nominated cause it is from LAST YEAR... Best New Artist 50 Cent Chingy Bone Crusher Lil Jon and The East Side Boyz Sean Paul Fuck Evanescence. 50 takes it easily, although all these dudes made a killer debut. Chingy put STL on the map, again, with Right Thurr and Holidae Inn back to back hits. Bone Crusher's Never Scared was one of the biggest hits of the year. Lil Jon made Krunk music a nation sweeping phenomenon, as did Sean Paul with Dancehall. Best Rap Collaboration Shake Ya Tailfeather - Nelly, PDiddy and Murphy Lee Beautiful - Snoop Dogg feat Pharrell Holidae Inn - Chingy feat Snoop and Ludacris What Happened To That Boy? - The Clipse feat Baby Magic Stick - Lil Kim feat 50 cent It goes to Snoop but Nelly and co. are equally as deserving. The other ones are all really great but the top two are the ones that deserve to win. And those are all the categories I care about... THE END

The superbowl was... SUPER! Aside from predicting exactly what would happen from the division finals on to the end of a "close" superbowl (yeah... so called that), I felt sad that the Panthers lost. I decided to cheer for them halfway through cause when you think about it, it was like Superbowl 36 except that the Patriots were the Rams (hottest team in the league) and the Panthers were the Pats (the underest of underdogs), except that this time the Patriots won. The halftime show sucked big time. Not only was everyone lipsyncing, except for Nelly and Justin (who basically just beatboxed anyways). They all did songs that were way old (rhythm nation???) and at the end Justin ripped off Janet's bra... wow. Way to go Justin. There was a streaker but they didnt show him. Just Teddy Bruschi's reaction like "oh my GOD". The MVP should've been David Givens at least. He was way more of a standout performer than Brady, so many great catches. After the bowl they had the "All-Star Survivor" I might be the only one that still watches it but Survivor is a great show still. This All-Star one looks pretty ill too. Richard Hatch is being all "I'm better than everyone" and then he takes his skirt off. And they voted off Tina, the winner of Australia (!!!). But yo, if you want to know who will be a player in this game, watch out for Rob Mariano, thats right Boston Rob . I predict that him, and Rob C. from Amazon will have an ill alliance with Amber from Australia and run tiiiings. Next to be voted off? Sue from the original... she is being a mad bitch right now... plus she drank the nasty water... ugh. that's it for now... paaaaaayce

I love both these teams. How can I pick a winner here? It's really reallly tough to say. I'm just glad the flyers aren't in the final, I hate the flyers. But I loooooove the lightning, and I love the flames too. So let's examine the factors: Forwards: Tampa has MVP Candidate Martin St. Louis, Calgary has MVP Candidate Jarome Iginla. Who is the better forward, hard to say. Most of Calgary's Forwards are relatively unknown or just guys with a hell of a lot of heart (Conroy, Gelinas) and one stars left over from the old Colorado team (YelleR). Tampa on the other hand has Brad Richards, Dave Andreychuck, Vincent Lecavalier, lots of great players. I still say this one is too close to call... Edge: Even Defence: Calgary has played some SICK D with guys you've never heard of (Montador?). Tampa has some tenacious D as well with Kubina, Sydor, and co. It all comes down to who can be more effective. I can easily see Kubina stepping up to the job of trying to cover Jarome Iginla. I'm not sure the Calgary defence will be able to handle Lecavalier, Richards, and St. Louis all at once. Edge: Lightning Goaltending: Kiiprussoff is the truth, this guy is at the top of his game right now. He is so flexible, he never takes his eyes off the puck, rarely has a bad game. Khabibulin is just as good. Both these goalies have carried their teams thus far. Kiprussoff, though, looks like he can carry his team all the way to the cup if he had to. Edge: Flames Special Teams: This is the only pretty lopsided category. The Bolts ARE a Powerplay team. They OWN powerplay. If you take too many bad penalties against the bolts they will strike and strike hard. Their offence is that explosive. They're also the better team on the PK. Calgary is good at both PP and PK, but no match for Tampa's superior special teams. Edge: Lightning Intangibles: The Flames have the best playoff song of the entire playoffs: "In The Dome" a rippoff of In Da Club which is so hot right now in Calgary. They have the best fans in this series, the loudest building and they're the better road team. They also have Harvey the Hound, voted best mascot in the NHL last year. Edge: Flames. Prediction: All I can say is this, it will come down to game 7. Who is the better team? We'll find out then. I feel bad for not picking the flames all playoffs even though I think they're awesome. I said three things mid season and two of them are coming true: Calgary will be this year's dark horse team, and The Lightning will be the team to win the east if the leafs don't. The other thing was that the Leafs would win the cup... :( I hate ROENICK! But if I had to pick a team to win at this point, it would be Tampa because they'll have home ice in game 7 and they just had a game 7 at home. Otherwise I'm just gonna sit back and enjoy the greatest stanley cup final that nobody will watch.
bobby clark is a maggot... a fuckin magot and u all know it Tampa in 7 byaaaaaaaaaaaaaaatch

If there was ever a needless continuation of an already ridiculously easy exam, this was it. I think everyone there can testify that all the questions were easy as HELL, even for someone with a 5 in systems. Option C, before the exam I didn't know what it was so I read the syllabus section for it ONCE and ran that option into the ground. Option C was soooo much easier than the others because it was 2 pages, and the other ones were at least 4. And the questions were like "name an endangered species..." (Giant Crayfish aka Tasmanian River Lobster!) "talk about a national park". And my personal fave "how can you identify a species you don't know?" for which "ask someone" gets you full marks. Chillness Rating: 11.7 out of 5 klondikes
a thought occurred to me while studying for systems paper 3... Polar Bears, the ultimate paradox: they're really cute, but they eat people.

Continuing with the IB Final exam updates... Systems Paper 1 and 2 A double exam, 2 papes. Paper 1 was SOOOOO easy. It's hard to imagine an exam being any easier than this. Multiple choice, 30 questions in 45 minutes and most of these questions are like "what would happen if we used less gas?" Wow. Thanks IB! Real hard exam. Paper 2 was a little harder. You had to actually write out your answer, but the questions were still like. "What is this: [5 marks]" and you get 10 lines to say "its a desert, retard!" chillness factor: 10 out of 5 klons ... and now for a shameless plug: Yo. I'm in a play. It's on Friday at BSS at like 7:30 (? i think) but still be there. It's good. It's FREE. You'll thank me later. peace

It's been a long time coming but your favourite website is back in action. I took a little break from blogging after tripod deleted the blog but now that Blogger went and got some kind of extreme makeover with comments and crazy new templates I couldn't resist. As if I had better things to do during exams. Anyways, I would like to publicly laugh at Rouleau's attempt to replace FOL with some kind of urlLink TDot2004 blog... hahaha. I'm just kidding man you know I love you. Anyways so what's been happening in this extended abscence from the internet I've had. Well, we had the musical, that was ill, I won Premier at OMP, which was also ill, and then I rapped in assembly and got a standing ovation, the illness continues. And now on with the show. And just when the final IB exams thought they were safe... IB Final Exam Marathon Update! that's right, it's that time of year again. English Paper 1 This one was a dry run for most of us. I know I got in there and basically stared at the blank IB stationery in front of me and this crazy poem about some kids planting a tree and I was just like... "what the f-" for about fifteen minutes. My brain slowly got readjusted to critical thinking (it's been a LONG third term) and got into the rhythm of writing an essay and in the end I got a solid essay out somehow. After that initial uneasiness though it was all downhill. Easy exam. chillness factor : 4.5 klons out of 5 Math Studies Paper 1 WhOA STUDIES! This one was pretty easy. I mean it could've been a LOT easier. It seemed the IB Math people decided that they didn't like studies anymore and they put all the hardest studies topics on it and none of the easy ones... come on, you call that a LOGIC question? I didn't tear it up as much as I thought I would, but in the end it was still torn up. chillness factor : 4 klons out of 5 Math Studies Paper 2 WhOoOoOA STUDIES! Okay so we all know Paper 2 is the hard one. And this held true. It was harder than Paper One but somehow I managed to answer the questions adequately. I have to admit there were some questions that I just found way too hard and probably didn't do so hot on, but the majority were cake. Chocolate cake. Especially the Stats option... wow. And I hate stats. chillness factor : 3.2 klons out of 5 English Paper 2 This one was the one I was most worried about. With all that memorising poems and quoting without the poem in front of you stuff... I had a good question in mind and when it wasn't there I was like "F$%@" but then I found one that actually applied to ALL the poems I studied. I used 6 different ones with quotes. It was a solid essay. holler. chillness factor : 4.2 klons out of 5 don't you love blogging? cause i do. AND NOW THERE'S COMMENTS... none of that "feedback system" stuff with my email. but don't abuse it or i take it away. it's good to be back. Spence, Bish, Bateman, all you guys on that list that I forgot had priveleges: POST! peace

I'm OUT.

who called it? who called it? i called it mid season. "the leafs will win the stanley cup. but if they don't it will be the tampa bay lightning." -me circa a couple months ago, cowie will confirm. Dave Andreychuck finally finds Stanley after 22 years. Way to go Dave. Lukowich will get his name on the cup this time. Richards finally outshines his old buddy vinny, who might have managed to permanently move out of tortorella's doghouse if he had scored on that breakaway (!!) Mighty Mouse Martin St Louis might remember big number 4 steve mckell from the UVM days... but he's thinkin more about havin a HART these days. Best final in years, by far. Tampa deserves it. Calgary gave it their all too and they deserve much respect. Jarome is kickin himself for touching that trophy now... Thank you NHL for another great year, let's hope the CBA guys can just realise that we NEED HOCKEY NEXT YEAR and just solve this mess. It's a wrap

I WAS WRONG! Man Game 7 will be totally awesome, and by that I mean totally sweet. Will Dave Andreychuck finally win the cup after 22 years? Will the "canada's team" aka (some backwater oiltown's team hyped to death by the canadian media) take the cup "home" (aka to the flat brown wasteland of alberta)? All I know is this, Iginla is african for big Tree and when a big tree stands alone in a very flat area (ie Alberta) then he runs the risk of being struck by LIGHTNING. Coincidence? I think not. Calgary is not my home. Nor are the flames my team. I am from Toronto, and my team is the Leafs. When the leafs are out, I pick favourites based on who I like and my love for good good hockey. Tampa wins, in overtime, the goal being scored by your playoff MVP Bradley Richards. Dave Andreychuck kisses Lord Stanley's Cup after it eluded him for 22 years. In the unlikely event of a Calgary victory, Miikka Kiprusoff will win the MVP, it will still be cool, but Andreychuck will cry and so will Doug Gilmour watching at home. Which makes me sad. Here's to a great final and a great game 7.
